reviews.reviewText:
Aesthetically this electric kettle is quite nice. I've been using it for about one month now, on average 4-6 times a day. I use for making instant coffee , teas, coffee press, chicory, and heating water for cooking. My previous electric kettle was stainless steel model that lasted about 3 years before the heating element died.

Positive features as follows. I like that there is no plastic, other than a silicone lid seal. Heating element is stainless and the rest is ceramic. It heats quickly as most of these kettles do. The switch lights blue during heating and will make a soft click when water has reached a boil and it shuts off. If you remove the kettle during heating phase and then return it to the base it will continue to heat the water. ( my previous units all shut off when removed from the base). This is not a negative necessarily but good to know especially if you're not used to this detail.

Some features I'm not so happy with are are follows:
not too easy to fill through the spout so I have to remove lid each time.

Blue color doesn't appear to be a ceramic glaze but rather some kind of paint that I suspect may fade/ peel over time. There is also a min. / max indicators 'painted' on the inside.

After pouring there will inevitably be some water dripping along the spout.

Despite these minor disappointments I still recommmend this kettle. Although I can't comment yet on longevity, I do suspect this will last a long time. The build quality is superior.

Update: Having used this kettle for 5 months straight, I have had no issues. It continues to work flawlessly. The design (blue color) has not faded or chipped off. It can be a little tricky to clean especially at spout and small drain holes. Luckily having a water softener makes this an infrequent need. A little baking soda and vinegar will do the trick. I've increased my rating to a 5 since I really am quite fond of this kettle.

reviews.reviewTitle: this kettle is beautiful and works great
reviews.reviewText: first off, this kettle is beautiful and works great. But, after 2 months of light use i noticed my counter being wet, and upon further inspecting the kettle, there was a hairline crack on the side that would slowly drip water.

Like some others here have commented, I noticed a pool of water beneath my kettle the first two times I used it. Weird, I thought. I ALMOST returned it. But then, I figured something out that I hope will spare others the pain of believing they must return this otherwise perfect kitchen necessity.

Turns out that the "max" line indicated for water level inside the pitcher is NOT the line you should fill to. Instead, if you fill with water to a point falling between the indicated "max" and "min" lines, then your tea kettle will no longer "leak." Nevermind any bitter thoughts on how an item should work without us having to muddle out its quirks. Manufacturers, like the rest of us, are imperfect. But if you can get over this teensy flaw, you get to keep an otherwise delightful and useful tea kettle.

The only other thing I should mention is that it is quite heavy, so your little ones and some elderly will have a lot of difficulty wielding it. For the rest of us, we get a bicep bonus workout! Oh, goody!

reviews.reviewTitle: Do not bother- terrible customer service and slow to boil
reviews.reviewText: Do not bother- I bought this kettle 6 months ago. It now takes almost 7 minutes to boil. Today I went to put the lid back on and the handle snapped off the lid. I bought a warranty with Assurion when I purchased it through Amazon so I called them, they said the manufacturers warranty is still good for 1 year so I called Bella- they said they are out of lids and that I should call them in about 4 weeks...in the meantime I can't get the lid off my kettle to fill it!..... What type of customer service is that!? I asked if the fact that they are out of lids might reflect that this is a manufacturing flaw to which they had no response. I asked for an entirely new kettle since I was not willing to wait 4 weeks and they said no, absolutely the worst customer service experience that I have ever had. Save yourself the money, buy from another brand.

We've had this kettle since March of 2016, using it sparingly. We've loved it until this morning when it literally exploded the "snout" off of it while it was warming up. Absolute mess of glass all over the kitchen.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great for tea and coffee drinkers alike!
reviews.reviewText:
I'm on my second Bella 1.2L electric ceramic kettle. I purchased the blue model about two years ago and had no problems with it whatsoever. Unfortunately, I was groggily making tea one morning and accidentally bumped the kettle into the side of the sink, breaking the spout. I do not see this as a manufacturing defect, just my stupidity. Of course it could chip/crack/break if handled improperly; it's ceramic!

I'm on my second kettle, the silver model, and have been using it three times a day, every day and have not had one hiccup. The water gets good and hot, but not so hot that you'll burn your tea leaves. It boils pretty fast. I fill it up first thing in the morning, and then go about prepping the rest of my breakfast. It's usually done in a matter of minutes.

I drink out of normalish size mugs and get about three servings out of a max fill. If you have smaller mugs or need more room for milk, you'd get more servings. When I use a French press to make coffee for guests, I fill the kettle to the max fill line and usually have a little water left over in the kettle after filling the French press.

I do notice a little discoloration, likely from mineral deposits, on the stainless steel heating element on the bottom of the inside of the kettles. I'll soon fill the kettle with vinegar overnight and let the vinegar do it's magic on the mineral deposits.

It is a heavy kettle compared to other electric kettles I've used. I wouldn't recommend for people with weak wrists, hands, or arthritic issues.

reviews.reviewTitle: Good thing that it wasn't full of boiling water
reviews.reviewText: Purchased June 2016. Used for just 9 months. Did not hit it against anything but the handle cracked today at the bottom. Good thing that it wasn't full of boiling water. Very nice looking kettle but quality is poor, this kettle should have lasted at least a couple years under normal wear and tear.

Disappointed, within 6 months this started leaking. I couldn’t figure it out until I stopped and watched it. And then I saw it would sweat as it heated up the water and so much so that it would puddle onto the counter. Such a hazard. Bummer it’s totally cute but not worth the risk of getting electrocuted.

Attempted to contact Bella for replacement but I would have to package and send on my own dollar. No thanks, will buy a new kettle from a better company that stand by their products.

This kettle was great until it stopped working after 2 months. I get it, sometimes great products have failures. It was outside of Amazon return timeframe and the exchange process with Bella is a hassle. Mail in 2" of the power cord of the base (it is an extra wide cord and you need more than scissors), the silver sticker and a printed receipt that shows the order date to Quebec AND THEN Bella ships a replacement kettle. I told the representative I was disappointed in the process. And I asked the representative if I would have to fill out a customs form because of the 2" of cord and she said no. The post office did in fact make me fill out a customs form for an unusable piece of cord and charged me $10.

My recommendation to Bella is that they trust their customers and lose the requirement of sending 2" of the power cord which is a) hard to cut without tools and b) creates a $10 shipment and customers form for those in the US.

I suppose I will eventually receive a replacement but am shopping for something else - I will not be buying another Bella product. Too much hassle for a $40 item.

This kettle looks gorgeous. I love how it adds a decorative touch for a utilitarian item. I like that this keeps one burner free when making breakfast in the morning, and means I don't have to use my stove to make tea in the evenings. The spout works well for pouring, we use it primarily for use with our french press.

Pros:
-Boils very carefully
-Doesn't take up a lot of space
-Looks lovely on the countertop
-Has a low boil off measure (I've never forgotten to turn it off, but it says it does this)
-A very clear on/off toggle that looks like crystal (and has a blue light)
-The cord can be coiled under the base if you have it very close to an outlet.

Cons:
-No alert for when the kettle has reached boiling (This is my biggest complaint---I have to guess if the water is ready)
-Won't turn off after an allotted time, will boil until the safety measure for low-water turns it off.

reviews.reviewTitle: LOVE THIS ELECTRIC TEA KETTLE MORE THAN I PROBABLY SHOULD!!!
reviews.reviewText: One of the best purchases I ever made! I can't tell you why I love it so much, but I will try. I had seen one at a friend's house and couldn't imagine why you would need one more kitchen appliance that does nothing more than boil water. Makes no sense. But I took advantage of a Prime Day special, and this is my most favorite thing in my kitchen now. It boils water faster than stove top or microwave. I had a thousand boxes and bags of tea that nobody ever drank, and now I drink tea everyday, which was a goal of mine. Why did I not boil water with a kettle or the microwave? I can't tell you, but it just didn't happen. Seemed like way too much trouble. Now, I plug this thing in, and I have tea or instant coffee in an insane amount of time, like less than a minute. I had to make boxed mac-n-cheese and didn't want to wait for the water to boil cuz i was in a hurry, and voila - the electric tea kettle gave me macaroni in a flash. I just poured the boiling water into the pot of raw macaroni and it cooked them! The possibilities that have opened up to me since buying this thing have been life-changing. I'm not kidding. And there is no kettle-whistle noise which used to drive me crazy. It shuts off when it's reaches boiling: you will not burn your house down. And you can go back and pour a refill if needed. I use it now for my French Press and that goes faster as well. It's just easy. And fun. I recommend this thing.

After ordering and trying two other kettles that failed for various reasons, available on Amazon, I was happy to find a kettle that was ceramic.
It is hard to find a kettle that is not made with substandard materials. I did not want any plastic or aluminum but a material that does not or would not leach harmful metals or toxins. Items made in China seem to be the worse offenders. So, this was the kettle I settled on because it is ceramic and since I ordered it last fall, it has worked well until this past week.
The kettle was kept on a coffee cart and used every morning for a single cup of drip coffee and here and there for a cup of herbal tea.
I was more than disappointed this past week when after it heating a full kettle of water, upon picking it up off the heating base, water everywhere. A horizontal crack appeared about 3” from the bottom of the kettle. This crack is about 4” long. Really disappointing because I have understanding in regard to ceramic/glass and the fact that you do not want to ‘shock’ these types of materials with extreme temperatures. Not wise to pour cold water into a hot pot, which I never did. I am aware of this fact and instead, filled the kettle in the evening with more water after it’s morning use when it was room temperature. So, I never put cool water into the kettle while hot. The kettle is now useless and a big bummer for me because it is too late for a refund. I would NOT recommend this kettle because even with good care, it failed. I will say that visually, it is very nice though.

reviews.reviewTitle: It's a really big and heavy kettle!
reviews.reviewText: I should have checked the weight of this kettle. It's too heavy to be practical. I need to use both hands to lift it up from the base when there's water in it. It's really big, too. It took at least 5 min, to boil water, so it is not powerful as it's described. I wish I would I could return it, but I need to pay $6 for return shipping. I regret buying it without thinking about the weight.

reviews.reviewTitle: Cracked handle within one month of use
reviews.reviewText:
Within one week of receiving the kettle, we noticed a small crack had formed on the top of the handle. I wanted to love the kettle so I told my husband "it's probably just a small crack in the ceramic, no big deal." Sure enough, within another month of using the kettle, the crack started to get bigger and now it's very obvious that if we're not careful, the whole handle will break off. It's really unfortunate, and I'm no longer able to return it to Amazon. So we've just decided to tape around the crack so that hopefully it will last us a bit longer, but obviously looks terrible. I think that in the end, the product quality doesn't match up to the design, and I'd want to warn those who are buying it to be aware of it.

**Edit** I’ve been using this kettle on and off for about a year and a half. The spout just broke off while I was holding it in my hand, I hadn’t boiled any water yet, I was just about to fill it with some water. and cut my finger. It’s pretty but like most things these days, it’s just not made to last.

reviews.reviewTitle: So far the kettle is great
reviews.reviewText:
Aesthetically pleasing, heaver then a metal kettle, but that's expected as it is made out of ceramic. Boils water fast and queit, very easy to use. Also the handle and top, from what i read are made of a different material then ceramic so it will not get hot like the rest of the kettle. The only 2 cons is the top cover is very hard to take off and put back in because of the rubber stopper (which i know is supposed to be as to make sure no water escapes). The 2nd con is like others have mentioned i noticed a smell once i opened up the kettle. I boiled water for the first time to clean it, but the smell was still there, so now i have the hot water from the 2nd boil sitting in the kettle with some baking soda....hopefully that gets rid of the smell, if not I will try the vinegar method. Will update.

UPDATE:

So...the smell diminished but never went away, but I'm guessing its never going away and it might just be because the kettle is mostly ceramic. I don't taste anything when I brew tea or other hot drinks.

reviews.reviewTitle: Exceeds My Expectations, Still Very Happy After One Year
reviews.reviewText:
I no longer drink coffee and was using my Kcup machine for hot water for my tea. My machine is getting old and not working very well so I decided I better find a convenient way to heat water quickly and save the machine for kcups only ( others drink coffee). Very pleased with this kettle so far. I wanted a ceramic kettle and although I didn't care for the modern tile design, I decided that this kettle best met my needs for a ceramic kettle. It's much larger than I imagined but I can handle it fine and I don't mind the design ( silver tile) even though it is a bit contemporary for my taste. The thing I really love about this kettle is that it heats so quickly that I don't have to wait but just two minutes ( if that) for a very hot cup of tea. I don't wait for a rapid boil. As soon as I see steam coming out of the neck, I turn it off and the water is PLENTY hot. The handle doesn't get hot and the lid doesn't get hot but the body does of course so one must be careful not to touch it. The lid is secure/won't fall off but I still hold it out of habit when pouring and it helps keep the pot balanced. I like that it has a removable base. The plug is a heavy duty three prong grounded plug and it is recommended that you use a dedicated receptacle which I don't have so what I do is not run anything else from that receptacle while heating. The only other thing I use that receptacle for is my can opener and so, I'm not concerned. It's made in China which disappoints me and I hope it lasts. I normally don't like many small appliances in my kitchen but this kettle is definitely worth the purchase since I don't have to turn on my stove and heat a kettle( and my kitchen) for ten minutes for one cup of tea.
After one year of use the only thing I've noticed is that the heating time does slow down a bit but I also noticed that when I descale it, it seems to heat faster. So maybe the lime scale slows it down? I've not had any cracks or other problems. As far as weight goes, I don't like filling it at the sink because it's a bit hefty so I keep a bottle of filtered water to use for refilling.
UPDATE Nov. 1, 2018: As of July 2017, I owned this Bella kettle for one year with no problems other than it's heavier than I can handle at this point ( I have a lot of MS weakness symptoms due to Lyme). Yesterday, I noticed that my countertop was covered in water. In the direct sunlight, I was able to see water droplets forming quickly in a ring around the kettle. The kettle had formed a crack right where the wider base meets the more narrow top half. Oh well. I got a lot of use from it. My only warning is that no one who has dexterity problems or muscle weakness should use this.

reviews.reviewTitle: It says that it is super quick to heat the water
reviews.reviewText:
1. it is bulky - much bulkier that I would have expected from the picture. I got this for the elegance and the ceramic - no elegance.
2. It says that it is super quick to heat the water. FALSE. This is MUCH slower than ANY other electrical kettle I had (and I had quite a few over the years). The $20 or so Oster (stainless steel) one was the last one before this one that just quit heating one day but it did heat the water much faster.

It heats the water and it is ceramic. Overall it's an OK product but huge disappointment for me - hence 3 stars.

Boils water relatively quick. It is pretty heavy. I need to use 2 hands to hold it after filling/boiling - if I use one hand I'm shaking. I don't mind it though because it is made of ceramic. I tried using a metal one before & it rusted. Then we switched to a plastic one and after a while it started smelling like burnt plastic. I have kids at home; if it was just myself I won't be as concerned but I don't want my kids drinking water that's smelling like burnt plastic. So I decided to spend more on getting ceramic. So far it's been a few months and has been holding up well.

It's also made with pretty thick walls so I'm not too scared about it hitting the wall or the table. But I do put it down gently & take care of it.

It's also nice and pretty in my kitchen. I have an open kitchen so I do try to buy things that are more decorative.

I had a working kettle but it wasn’t allowed on the counter once anyone is done with it because it looked horrible! This one works well and looks amazing. I even moved some stuff aside to let it permanently live this winter on our precious counter space.

This Tea Kettle is pretty awesome! First let me just say that I do have arthritis pretty bad in my left hand, and the weight does not bother me too much. I had posted a question to another reviewer before my purchase about it's weight, and never received a reply. Anyways, The inside does not, I repeat does not have a plastic layer, it is ceramic, just as the outside is. It heats water very fast (you will actually hear the boiling sound), and when the water is ready the button on the bottom will flip off, and the blue light will no longer be on. If you fill the kettle to the max line, you can get one french press with two cups of coffee capacity, and for me one bowl of oatmeal worth of water out of it. The design is really eye catching and I have received quite a lot of compliments on it, as I use it at work to have hot water through the day for tea. I have not smelled any weird smells from the device either. So in all I'd say it is a pretty nice little kettle, and worth the investment.

reviews.reviewTitle: Beautiful kettle, great design, slightly small.
reviews.reviewText:
I love almost everything about this kettle. I had a metal kettle before, so I especially love how it heats up quickly, quietly, and turns itself off without whistling. I also love that I don't have to worry if I turned the stove off after I used it. The inside is mostly ceramic, with only a metal base and heating element. I live in an area that has a lot of hard water, which destroyed the inside of my metal kettle, but this one has been holding up fine. The design is as pictured, and I really love it.

Downsides: It is significantly heavier than my metal kettle (obviously), and the outside does get quite warm after boiling water. Granted, the base and handle stay cool, but since it's so heavy, my instinct is to hold the side. My main complaint is the size. We use it in the mornings for a large french press and two bowls of instant oatmeal, and it barely makes enough for this. This probably just means I need a bigger kettle, but be warned that 1.2L felt like a lot less than I was hoping for. Giving it 5 stars because the only complaints I have are based on my needs, not on the actual design and function of the kettle.

reviews.reviewTitle: So happy I gave it a shot.!
reviews.reviewText: Wow, this is even prettier in person! I'm so happy I gave it a shot. I almost didn't...I mean how difficult is it to fill a standard stove top kettle to boil some water? And I was worried about cluttering my counter. But this baby really is so easy to use, and bonus, there's no annoying whistling or forgetting to turn the stove off. And bottom line...it's MUCH faster. By the time I've got my tea bag ready, the water's done. Plus, it looks awesome on my counter and works with my blue & white decor. It's ceramic, so it's a tad bit heavier than a plastic unit, but I don't care, it's no heavier than a full tea kettle. And pouring from the longer spout is easier to control. It's as functional as it's lovely which makes up for the little bit of heft. I prefer it over plastic any day. Very happy with this high quality and beautiful electric kettle.

I have been using this kettle 5x or more a day for about two weeks now. I wanted to write a review after putting it to the test. This ceramic kettle is absolutely incredible. It's stunning, adds a touch of class to my counter, and boils water in less than 3 minutes. Seriously. I've timed it. I use it to heat my baby's water for his bottles & I flip the switch and 25 seconds later I have perfectly warmed water. It's amazing! So much faster and easier than the Dr browns bottle warmer I used for months! I also use this to heat water for tea (about 1 minute or else it's too hot) and to boil water for pasta if I'm in a rush. There's no wrong way to use this kettle and you won't regret buying this item. I got no discount, I paid for this myself. I genuinely LOVE this kettle! If it broke tomorrow I would repurchase in an instant. This is also how lots of people heat their water in Ireland, which is pretty neat. 5 stars!

reviews.reviewTitle: We LOVE this! We have had it for over a ...
reviews.reviewText: We LOVE this! We have had it for over a month now and it works like a charm and heats up super fast- much faster than a tea kettle on the stove. It pours perfectly in your cup too. I especially like the detail to function and design, since we leave ours on the counter all the time (at least for the winter)- a well thought out kitchen appliance with the combination of the retro teapot design and the updated trendy pattern on the front. One thing to be aware of is the weight- because it is ceramic, it is heavy. One way to resolve constantly picking it up - we keep ours right next to the sink and just use our kitchen faucet pull-out to fill it, so we rarely take it off the heating plate except to pour out old water and freshen it occasionally. Definitely a well designed production that works wonderfully.

reviews.reviewTitle: I'm glad I went ceramic instead of buying another plastic water kettle
reviews.reviewText:
I've had nothing by plastic/"stainless steel" water kettles over the years, and for the most part they worked fine for what they did. When the last one was retired after the metal spout rusted within weeks after purchase, I decided that it was time to see what all the fuss was about with ceramic water kettles, and I'm glad I did. We use this daily, multiple times a day, and I have yet to see any rust forming in the few metal parts this has.

Water heats up at about the same rate as other kettles I've used. This kettle is significantly heavily, especially when filled with water, than it's plastic cousins, but no one in the house seems to mind it. For obvious reason, the ceramic get hot, so its a bit tricky pouring out a cup when its full of recently boiled water. Again, +6 months of daily usage and no one's been scolded by hot water, something I couldn't say with the plastic kettle I had before this one.

Only down side is since this is a solid ceramic pot, and not double walled, water does tend to cool down faster. Not an issue when immediately after boiling, but a 15 minute delay will result in warm, not hot, water.

Oh, and it definitely adds a little something to the overall kitchen appearance verses the plastic thing we previously had.

I would have no issues repurchasing or recommending this ceramic water kettle.

reviews.reviewTitle: Easy to use, not to clean.
reviews.reviewText:
I purchased this a few years back during my undergraduate years, and it was such a lifesaver for mornings. In fact, it was a perfect product for late-night tea, or in combination with a coffee press for mornings that were crunched for time. I never had an issue with cracks or breaking, as others have mentioned, despite it getting knocked around in plenty of boxes while moving.

However, over time, I began to notice that there was seemingly mold appearing in the crevices of the kettle interior (if I remember correctly, this was primarily in the kettle handle, which is hollowed out and allows for water to flow through inside), despite it getting washed fairly regularly. Despite washing thoroughly, scrubbing everywhere that a toothbrush or sponge can reach, and placing it in the dishwasher, nothing can reach these hard-to-reach areas on the interior. This is sad, as I'm reluctant to use it now, but did get a wonderful year or two out of it.

I love love love this kettle! It is a lot bigger than i expected and I mean that in a good way. I got the smallest size and from the pictures I thought it would be short and narrow but its standard teapot size once the max fill line is considered. This is good quality as well. The ceramic is nice and heavy so no fear of easy breaking. Its so pretty and elegant. Its easy pour too, no need to hold the lid, no water splashing. Generally im terrible at serving tea because i have small shaky hands but the water streams out of this with such ease that I don't spill a drop.

It has an auto shutoff when the water reaches low boil so you dont have to worry about boiling all the water out of it because you forgot it. Simple on and off switch, it lights blue when on and turns back clear as a crystal when its off.

There are some metal components inside the pot so it is not 100% ceramic but thats not an issue for me. I just make sure its wiped dry inside at the end of the day. The handle doesn't get hot or anything like with some metal kettles. I would recomend this to anyone.

reviews.reviewTitle: Works well, but gets SUPER HOT
reviews.reviewText: I use this tea pot several times a day. It is attractive and handy. The capacity is 5.5 cups, so if you use the big mugs popular these days, it is good for about two and a half cups, so I have had friends complain that it doesn't make enough for when they have company. But for my purposes it is a perfect size. The only problem with it is that it gets SUPER HOT. So, unless I add a coupel of ice cubes it can take 20-30 minutes until my tea can safely be consumed, even after a 10-15 minute brewing time.

It stopped working after about 3 weeks, but that was right before we were moving and I did not have time to bother with returning this thing (didn't keep original box). Of course, there is only a 30 day return window which I missed. Basically, the switch no longer turns it on. What a piece of junk. Wasted $44.

I really wanted to like this tea kettle. The awesome granite look and the fact the carafe is ceramic was the reason why I bought it.

Hold on. The touch pad for the temperature control is where the problem lives. It didn’t matter What temperature setting I selected it always defaulted to some low temperature.

I drink anything between instant coffee, green tea and black tea. I need more than one temperature setting.

Unfortunately back to the Amazon Warehouse it goes.

Great Electric Kettle. Love the Ceramic! I grew up with electric kettles, so I knew how convenient they were. However my parents always had plastic ones, and I didn't want to boil my water in plastic, so I never got one for myself. My daughter has fallen in love with tea, but would sometimes forget to turn off the pot of water on the stove at the right time, and I was afraid she would boil one dry. I started looking for glass ones, but didn't want something fragile. This ceramic one is Perfect! There is a silicone seal on the lid, but it doesn't come in contact with the water. At 1.5 L, it holds enough for several large cups. Since it is ceramic, it stays warm a long time. It won't turn on if water level is below "min" so there is no risk of boiling it dry. We have moderately hard water, but no build up so far after daily use for two months. I am buying one now for my dad, who has very hard water, so I will update after he uses it for a while. The only negative is that a full Kettle is quite heavy. I only notice when making coffee with you pour-over cone (I'm not terribly graceful making a circular pour with this big kettle) . So it may be difficult for someone who is frail or has problems gripping heavy items.
My wife bought this kettle for her French press. She absolutely loves it and can't stop talking about how pretty it looks!

The kettle is beautiful and mostly well made. There are only a couple of cons I've noticed so far. 1. The cord in the pictures makes it look retractable but it's just a really bulky cord that's wrapped around the inside of the base, so you basically have to unwrap the whole thing to plug it in anywhere. It's completely fine if I had known, I just thought I was getting a retractable cord that would take up less space. 2. It does take longer to heat up water than most newer/uglier kettles on the market. I knew going in it wouldn't be a fast one and I chose the look of it instead of the faster function, but just in case someone reading this wants a faster heating kettle I wanted to mention it. 3. The very light plastic base doesn't seem very sturdy or like it will last nearly as long as the hefty ceramic kettle.

The reason I bought it though, is because every other kettle out right now is ugly stainless steel or glass and this fits my decor so much better. It really is beautiful and the ceramic kettle part is very well made and seems like it will hold up for a very long time. It does heat the water well(just not fast) and it holds a decent amount. The lid stays on very well and has never gotten too hot for me to touch or hold while pouring tea. It is a little heavy but nothing I can't hold while filled with water. It's served it purpose perfectly so far, to heat up water in a beautiful kettle that I can keep on my counters. Seriously, it's gorgeous!

Also, shipping was great with my Prime subscription. It came within 2 days and delivered on a Sunday. Thanks Amazon and Bella!

The kettle heats well and fast. The actual pot is more beautiful in person. If it weren't for the durability, I'd give it 5 stars. The ceramic is not as durable as you might hope. The top handle broke when we took it off and set it (not threw) onto the counter. No superglue keeps it on and it continually breaks off, so we can no longer use. I'd definitely be careful about purchasing unless you plan on treating it like it's fine china.

Absolutely awful! I’m writing this review after 2 months of the purchase. First of all, it’s heavy and second it started flaking white particles, just couple weeks after. I want to return it, but it’s too late!!!

reviews.reviewTitle: Pretty but also very hot to touch
reviews.reviewText:
Pretty but also big, heavy, especially with water. It's made of ceramic I think and its very heavy and also very hot to the touch. Make sure you only hold the handle.

This would have been very nice if it was made of the same material as corelle so it would be very durable and much lighter. This one is very tricky to maneuver when it's very hot. This kettle burned my fingers and hand every single time. Ive had other kettles thats steel and its much lighter and ive never burned my hand there cuz its much lighter even with water so its much easier to maneuver.

Im kinda regretting getting this one. Only got it cuz my kettle broke and this one is so pretty. Yes, i got this cuz its pretty. Lol

I used to own a Smeg Kettle. I loved how it looked, but it fell apart in a short time (especially considering the price.) I really shopped around for a new kettle--I didn't want it to do too many things, I didn't want it to beep incessantly, and I wanted it to feel good. I looked online and went to retail stores to feel the kettles I was considering. I finally settled on this Bella kettle because it's completely ceramic and super simple. I love it. The tea pot style spout makes it pour more nicely, and with so few moving parts, nothing can break. It's super quiet which I like and its vintage look fits my kitchen. After so much agonizing, I'm so pleased with this kettle and it's half the price of the Smeg and feels better made. No plastic. I was also worried I wouldn't like removing the lid completely to fill it (as opposed to popping the lid with a switch which most metal kettles have) but it's actually easy and I like the snug fit. It's super solid. I rarely write a review but am so pleased that I felt compelled to make sure I wrote one up.

Lovely kettle to keep out on my countertop and it works well. You can't really run water into the spout to fill it so you have to take the top off each time. Not a big deal, just something to keep in mind. Another thing I had not considered (for some reason) is that this kettle is quite heavy. I've only ever had the stainless steel before and was surprised at the weight of the empty ceramic kettle. It's fine, I just feel like I need to be extra careful not to drop it since the surface gets hot and I can't use my other hand to stabilize it while pouring.

reviews.reviewTitle: Stopped working within a few months
reviews.reviewText: This kettle is very heavy which made it less functional for me. It does look nice. I accidentally dropped the lid though and the lid handle broke so I didn't feel like the material works well for something I would be using a few times every day. The kettle stopped working within a few months. It no longer turned on

I am happy I went off of Amazon reviews and purchased this kettle!
Pros:
• No plastic - the constant reheating of the translucent plastic strip often in kettles can't be good for you!
• Very stylish - have received a ton of compliments
• Quickly heats water and clearly signals when it is done heating (the switch isn't blue any longer and clicks to a new position)

Cons:
• Doesn't hold a lot of water between the maximum fill and minimum fill (mind you I stay between those lines - obviously it would heat more if I didn't) I am filling up nearly everytime, but as I live alone doesn't bother me!
•haven't dropped it but a little worried about the durability if i happened to - although kettles aren't exactly made to be dropped

This has been one of my favorite purchases this year. I decided to finally replace my Braun kettle because I'd owned it for 7 years and was just tired of looking at it. I was initially considering similar plastic kettles in the $90-120 range but stumbled across the BELLA and I'm thrilled. It's beautiful on my countertop and it pours so neatly. The ceramic makes it feel more substantial and like a proper tea kettle. It doesn't look like an appliance. It was also half the cost of anything else I was considering. It is heavier than a plastic kettle but it isn't too heavy. Even when full I have no problem lifting it and pouring but for someone with poor upper body strength it might prove to be a little unwieldy. There's no indicator for how full this is but I always have the habit of dumping the water and refilling each time anyway. I don't see how an indicator could be implemented without it impacting the beautiful design but I do understand that a regular tea drinker could find it annoying.

This pot is an absolute beauty, for looks it is a 5 star, the Pros: Looks great and elegant,large pot, 5 minutes and it's boiling, ceramic so no rusting that I hate, quiet, detachable so can be carried to counter or dinner table . Cons: No whistle or indicator that it's done only a very quiet click, heavy, lid is so tight scary to put too much force on pulling it off that it might fly off and break, bottom of the outer surface is hot to touch and not really well insulated. I would still recommend it, looks amazing and does the job

Love this electric teakettle! It is beautiful, and because it is ceramic it feels "fancy" and not like just another kitchen appliance. It holds enough water to make 5 cups of tea. The outside gets hot, but the handle is substantial enough to hang on to, so I don't mind. It heats the water fast, so we don't have to wait long. The only thing I wish was different is the cord- I wish it was white instead of black. The cord wraps around inside the base for storage.

reviews.reviewTitle: Beautiful product but defected with worst customer service
reviews.reviewText: The kettle itself is very pretty and worked wonderfully for the 4 months I have had it. Then one day - while not in use - i heard a click noise - and the kettle simply won't work. The on/off button is permanently stuck and there seems to be an inherent defect in its mechanical and electrical components. Since this has a 2 year warranty, I wasn't concerned thinking clearly they will refund or replace this to make it right. It has taken two weeks to get a response from customer service and with that I was told that this is not covered and there is nothing they can do. And now when i try to reply to the email, my messages are rejected as their mailbox is full. How is that even possible? Very disappointed with the service and overall quality of this product. I would have totally recommended the product itself if the customer service had done the appropriate thing and replaced or refunded the product. Save yourself the upset and headache and look elsewhere. So unfortunate.

reviews.reviewTitle: Pretty disappointed in this product if I could give it ...
reviews.reviewText: Pretty disappointed in this product if I could give it zero I would! it literally exploded when I had it less than two months. I reached out to the manufacture and sent pictures and they said they would not replace it. It looks cute but after it exploded and left an entire kettle full of water and ceramic shards on our floor I wouldn't recommend purchasing this.

The first one I ordered was a (renewed) kettle. I didn’t realize at the time. When I opened it it had a big crack down the side. They were great about returning it!!! The second one came a couple of days later I opened it to inspect it before giving it to my mom. It had water spots on one side of it. It needed shined up. wth? Aren’t these brand new? This one didn’t say renewed.

reviews.reviewTitle: Looks great and quality materials but slow to boil
reviews.reviewText: We purchased this kettle because it looks good on the countertop and has has no plastic compared to many other kettles on the market. Prior to purchasing I noticed many people mentioned it is slow to boil. I decided to ignore their reviews and purchase the kettle anyway. They were right, this kettle takes around 4 minutes to boil the minimum required water amount. Being the first electric kettle we have purchased I was expecting boiling water in around 2 minutes. If you are more concerned about esthetics, and/or materials the kettle is made of, over the speed of boil then this is the kettle for you.

reviews.reviewTitle: Beautiful but don't expect it to live long
reviews.reviewText: I enjoyed the looks of this on my counter. I lasted for one year and 10 months, which isn't terrible I suppose, but I was hoping for more years. I feel like I just bought it. I had an ugly, cheaper one before this that lasted for 7 years before it stopped working. It's usually the ugly things that refuse to break ;) I'm still contemplating buying another...

reviews.reviewTitle: A tea kettle that is classy!
reviews.reviewText: After my husband has almost burned our house down multiple times I decided our house would always have an electric kettle. This is our third after many years of using one. The ones we had before were fine but not attractive. The last one we had was metal inside and we didn't realize that the inside metal was literally falling apart. This time I wanted to try the ceramic one. We love it. For the first time I feel great having my tea kettle sit on the countertop. It's very attractive plus it keep the water heated longer. The only warning I would give is that it is heavy. Not for someone who has difficulty with arm/hand strength.

Just got this kettle today so I don't know how well it will last. The design is excellent. I'm 5'4" with medium palms and short fingers but the kettle with water in it feels balanced like a good knife. Whether it is at the minimum or the maximum full like the handle makes it effortless to pour. I will up date when I have used it for a while. I expect I will like it just as much in a year as I do now because I have never had any trouble with my Bella small appliances.

reviews.reviewTitle: Very pretty kettle but has two flaws
reviews.reviewText:
This kettle is very pretty but the kettle is too heavy, especially once you add water. There is no visible water gauge on the outside of this kettle. Due to feel weight of the kettle it feels like there is a lot more water in this kettle than what is actually inside. You have to remove the lid each time to add water so that you are assured you have surpassed the minimum water level. After two days I’m frustrated that I often end up with only a half of cup of hot water when the kettle feels like it’s full.
Not going to work for me though I will miss this pretty kettle on my counter.

At first I was very happy, but after 8 months of use, it's developed a leak.
It's not bad enough to toss it (yet), but I certainly would NOT recommend someone spending the extra money.
My cheap plastic one is at least 4 years old, and I'm not the first owner.

The company should fix their quality and offer a warranty that shows that it's a focus for them. (i.e. 5 years)

reviews.reviewTitle: The Bella Electric Ceramic Tea Kettle is a wonderful addition to our kitchen.
reviews.reviewText: I love this product because it heats up quickly, has boil dry protection, is detachable from the base leaving no chords to deal with while pouring, and looks amazing on the counter. I purchased the white marble version and it compliments my "white" cabinets and dark countertops. This kettle is highly recommended by us as a tea kettle or for use next to your french press/coffee station.

I'm absolutely loving this little kettle. My old stovetop kettle bit the dust suddenly and we were stuck with heating water for our pour-over coffee with a pot. After a little searching I came across this beauty and decided to order after reading some of the reviews. We've only had it for a couple of months but so far, I'm still in love. It's absolutely beautiful and one of those few kitchen appliances that you WANT to leave out on the counter even when it's not being used. It heats up the water right at 5 minutes. As other reviewers noted, it doesn't have any kind of sound to alert you when it's ready, other than the click the switch makes when it turns off. I actually prefer this - I hate the sound of buzzers/alarms. We're usually in the kitchen still getting everything ready for that 1st first cup anyway so we can hear the click when it goes off. Some other reviewers also mentioned that it's rather heavy, but again I like the weight of it as it doesn't feel like it's some kind of cheap kettle that's going to break into a million pieces the first time you bump it into the sink. This is our first electric kettle and I was a little hesitant in buying, but so far my husband and I are both are just loving this beauty!!

reviews.reviewTitle: Overall, good kettle. Heavy, but durable and quick.
reviews.reviewText:
I think this kettle is great. I love that it is ceramic even though it makes it very heavy. As long as you don't have tendonitis or carpel tunnel,etc then the weight of a full kettle shouldn't be that bothersome. I usually have one hand on the bottom of the kettle (to distribute the weight) since the base of it doesn't get hot (the bottom inch contains the heating element, etc). The hottest part to me would be the spout and the middle area.
It holds enough water for 4 mugs of tea.
I haven't had any need to clean it really since I'm only boiling water in it (I don't put the tea inside) and I use filtered water, not tap.
I find the lid to be very tight fitting on my kettle, which is great, but I choose to rest the lid on top instead. The silicone rim makes it stay on even when pouring (if the water level is at the minimum or higher) and no steam escapes so I don't bother pushing it onto the kettle all the way. I don't see the need when I'm not serving guests.
I would recommend this for anyone trying to avoid plastic kettles.
For Canadians, I would also suggest buying it off Walmart instead since they carry them for about 50 bucks. (I bought mine on sale for that here, but the exchange rate and shipping isn't cheap!)

Just received today so this is just a first impression review. Took about 4 minutes to boil full kettle. Not bad. I'll only need it for 2 cups of water so should be pretty quick. Knowing it was ceramic and having read from others that it was heavy, I fully expected it to be on the heavy side. Just not this heavy. It's heavy empty. My hands cramp easily so I will have to use both hands. I wouldn't recommend for someone with arthritis or other limitations. I will give this a shot for a while and see if I get used to it or end up getting tired of it. It is beautiful and sturdy, so I really hope I end up loving it. I did call the company and the gasket inside the kettle is NOT plastic as other reviewer mentioned. Four stars for now. Will update in a week.

reviews.reviewTitle: This was an amazing electric kettle, until it stopped working
reviews.reviewText:
This is an amazing electric kettle! I specifically bought this kettle because it did not have any plastic pieces that come in contact with the heated water. It's a bit heavy to handle because it's made of ceramic, but totally worth it. I highly recommend this kettle!

UPDATE
The kettle has stopped working and we're not sure what the cause might be. We've only had the kettle for 6 months. Luckily I purchased the Asurion protection plan for this product so I hope to either receive a refund or a new kettle as a replacement.

reviews.reviewTitle: ... kettle doesn't have a lot of bells and whistles like some kettles for tea-drinkers
reviews.reviewText: This kettle doesn't have a lot of bells and whistles like some kettles for tea-drinkers, like variable temperatures or anything. But it boils water quickly, and it looks really nice on the counter top, and it has a spout that really helps for accurate pours (helpful for things like French press and Aeropress coffee makers). Been using it for a couple months now, and it has done its job beautifully. Strongly recommend.

I liked this when it came although it is pretty large and bulky for 1.2 L. Unfortunately, it chipped after a few weeks of typical use on the edge of the lid (or it was chipped already and I didn't notice it because I didn't look under the lid). Then the handle started to separate a little from the canister at the top despite my never filling it past the max water level indicated. So now I have to hold it by the handle and under the bottom so it doesn't break off and drop to the floor burning me when it shatters. I probably got a lemon. But too late to return it and I just recently bumped the spout into the kitchen wall (clearly, my fault and not the manufacturer's) so now I have a chipped kettle glued precariously together with a breaking handle and a chipped lid. The glue is probably poisoning me with each cup of tea I drink. LOL. Going to just buy a regular stove top kettle today and steer clear of ceramic altogether.

Easy and looks amazing.

FYI the outside gets hot but the handle does not.

reviews.reviewTitle: Beautiful, but did not hold up over time.
reviews.reviewText: I ordered this product after a lot of research, initially I absolutely loved it. It works quickly is easy to clean and looks beautiful on top of it. This was important to me because I use it daily and keep it on the counter. Unfortunately after only a month the top broke, I paid to replace it, but now after only a few months of use it’s cracking again. Also the bottom seems to be worping and cracking just from daily use. Very disappointed.

This kettle is very large and heavy which makes filling it up a little difficult. Also, it only works 90% of the time. The other 10% of the time it will only heat the water until warmish (not hot) before switching off. Pretty annoying.

I wouldn't purchase this kettle again. But it does look nice and usually does its job. So I give it 2 stars instead of 1.

The first time I used the kettle I was super happy with it. I bought it to replace a metal one I had had since college and was really happy with it over all. On second use, filled to the max fill line, as instructed, then turned it on. It finished boiling, as normal. As I reach to pick it up, the kettle cracked all the way around spilling boiling water all over the counter and floor. Of course it happened after the window to return had expired. Amazon cannot do anything for me as it was not purchased from them. Hoping to hear back from Bella, will update if they do contact me.

This kettle is so disgustingly cute; I love it. It has a fancy switch to activate the boiling process. Once water reaches the boiling point, the switch turns off. The handle and bottom portion of the kettle remain cool to the touch. Some reviews say it’s heavy, but if you support the bottom (not hot) while pouring it’s easy peasy.

After extensive research looking for a replacement for my electric kettle, I discovered the Bella brand. Best electric ceramic kettle I have ever purchased. It is quick and quiet, and the blue indicator light is very easily seen. It is a tad heavy, but I look at it as strength training! I would hesitate to purchase this a a gift for an elderly or otherwise frail individual, but I really like it. It will be interesting to note how durable and long lasting it will prove to be. I will be back to update that information.

reviews.reviewTitle: Little plastic inside and im a little worried about the handle
reviews.reviewText:
much bigger than expected. My girlfriend loves this. I searched high and low for a plastic free electric kettle and this is as close as i got. there is a little piece inside but it is tiny and it can be removed. I believe its used to direct the flow of water coming out of the little tube inside. If you take it out the water will shoot up instead of over but i dont believe it has much effect on the performance. i left mine in but it is a little smaller than a dime so its not too bad. It also has a silicone seal on the lid but that has very little contact with the water if any and doesnt get hot.

I am worried about the handle on the lid. it has held up so far but the lid seems to be on tight and just dont see the handle lasting years when the only way to open the lid its to pull on it.

I LOVE this kettle! This is my second Bella tea kettle – I purchased the first in the blue pattern over 4 years ago for my old apartment, and left it at my parent's house when I moved across the country. This one in silver tile is for my new apartment. As far as I'm aware, the first one is still functioning perfectly well (I was home last month and it was!), and this one's working just like the first. I've had it for about 4 months now. It's just a beautiful addition to the countertop. I love the LED light on the switch, and honestly who cares if it's a tiny bit heavier than other kettles or takes a few seconds longer to heat up – it does the job well and it does it beautifully. Every time I walk into the kitchen it makes me smile, so just for that, it's beyond worth every penny :)

Being that our household uses a one cup filter to make coffee and single cups of tea at a time? It's hot water when we need it. We really didn't need different temperature boiling points besides, in previous electric kettles we've owned? That feature proved a shorter life span considering our heavy useage. I'm content with this product and suggest it. One side note - this is my second round with this kettle. I tend to unplug appliances when not in use. My first Bella's 3 prong plug lost it's grounding prong after about two years. I felt I got good use out of it and bought it again.

reviews.reviewTitle: It was beautiful, but now it's leaking and there aren't any chips or cracks.
reviews.reviewText: I loved this teapot until I didn't. I got it in February and it's currently end of May. It was fine and had no issues at all. Seemed very sturdy and I loved it! However, we just moved (and before anyone says that it must have gotten damaged, it didn't. I personally held this and it didn't get boxed up because I didn't want to risk it) and I just started to try and boil a pot of water and low and behold it's leaking SO BAD. It won't hold the water long enough for me to put it on the heating disk. There aren't any cracks or anything, it's leaking from the very bottom. So disappointed because it's so beautiful and was going to look stunning in our new kitchen. But now I can't use it and I prefer my decor to have purpose so I have no need for this now.

reviews.reviewTitle: Looks great, but wish it had better functionality.
reviews.reviewText:
This a very aesthetically-pleasing kettle, however, I'd prefer better functionality and won't repurchase. It's very heavy, and it gets very hot on the outside after coming to a boil. This is to be expected but it makes it difficult when trying to take off the lid and refill if you need to. The lid stays stuck on very well and sometimes is hard to pull off, especially if the kettle is hot. I also frequently wished I had a kettle that could show how full it is from the outside, rather than having to take off the lid and look inside.

I had this tea pot for two years and it just quit working today. Two years is probably a good timeline for a tea kettle that got as much use as mine did (we're a family of coffee and tea drinkers and use it frequently). I'll be buying a new kettle that is lighter and more functional. But I can't deny this is a beautiful tea kettle!

This is a beautiful kettle but heavier than the stainless steel electric kettle I used to have. Also, my old kettle had a short, wide spout so you could fill the kettle through the spout if you wanted, or it had a flip-top lid. This Bella kettle the only option for filling is to completely remove the (breakable) lid. If you have kids/teens using the kettle a lot this may not be the best choice. I'll probably go back to the style of my old kettle when this one needs replaced but for now it does what it's supposed to do and it sure looks pretty on my counter!

reviews.reviewTitle: Don't hesitate, it's beautiful and functional!
reviews.reviewText: I adore my kettle! It works perfectly and I have not had any problems with it at all! I have had it for over 6 months and use it regularly. I feel happy that it has held up so well! And it's pretty to boot! I get compliments on it all the time! I am happy with the ceramic interior. Minimal plastic and minimal stainless steel. I'm one of those people that can taste the metal in stainless steel stuff, so I was worried. But no issues at all!

The kettle is so cute, it boils water super quickly. I would highly recommend it to anyone looking to get an electric kettle. I like the fact that there is no plastic on the kettle itself only on the charging base

I was not sure which water pot to get, even returned a glass one because I didn’t like the look. I love the look of this pot. The water tastes great, it is quick. I was worried about the weight based on reviews but it is not a big deal at all. I wouldn’t have thought to mention it myself. Very happy with my purchase. And the price is half of what you would pay at a store.

reviews.reviewTitle: This one does not disappoint. It is beautiful to look at
reviews.reviewText: I drink a cup of tea at least twice a day. Once in the morning in a travel mug and once in the afternoon while at work. I teach in a school and do not have a microwave in my classroom. After months of using a rather inefficient microwave to make tea, I decided it was high time I bought myself a new electric kettle. This one does not disappoint. It is beautiful to look at, sturdy, and NOT PLASTIC which is a big deal to me. It works really fast to heat the water and turns off. My only complaint although minor in my opinion is the weight of the pot. It is HEAVY to lift one handed for me. For the price it truly cannot be beat! :)

Got a deal on this during the holidays and the recipient loves it. Just bought a second one for me and I love it, too! Been using an aging, drippy stainless model for years and this is a definite upgrade. Much more attractive, with minimal plastic involved and none in contact with the water being heated. It is both weightier and larger than the stainless HB, which could be a concern for someone who's really frail. But it's well balanced, the base is stable, the retractable cord stays put, and it seems worth the bit of extra counter space so far

I just love this little pot! It heats water quickly, pours perfectly, and just makes me happy! It is really lovely, decently weighty, and apparently well made. I am enjoying a cup of tea now, and I am thrilled at the thought of not needing to reheat another pan of water for my second cup! Plus, it will make me happy again when I see my pretty kettle!

So it's beautiful, no doubt, but it's cheaply made, reeks of the smell of plastic even after several uses and the lid won't pop up using button only. Loved the look so much I recycled the box or I'd return it.
Going to use it in my office where it will receive minimal use as I think it would break very soon if used daily. Not a good buy.

Beautiful. I had had it in my cart for quite some time. I was nervous about the other reviews as this would be used everyday. I can see the areas where it would be fragile but I think with proper care and no defects upon arrival it will last. The lid does have a tight seal and a small ceramic handle. I just use care when removing the lid. I love this kettle.

I love this kettle. So cute and sleek! Very functional. I would recommend being very careful as you secure the lid as it seems like too much pressure would break the lif. Other than that I have no complaints. This kettle has made my transition to tea from coffee so seamless.

Oh how I love this kettle. I never use my stovetop kettle anymore.
Pros-
Heats up quick.
Beautiful on your counter
Makes great tasting tea.
The handle stays cools
Has an automatic kick off feature.
Cons:
Very heavy once filled with water. It can be difficult for a person with arthiristis or weak wrists to lift and pour.
The sides and top get extremely hot. Use with care.

reviews.reviewTitle: Looks great... but it is HEAVY!
reviews.reviewText:
I really wanted this kettle because I like the way it looks. I still like it, but with reservations.
Before I bought this, I read reviews from customers who complained about the weight of the tea kettle. I thought, "Wimps! Get an exercise video." Well, I stand corrected. The thing weighs a ton, even without water. With water, you need both hands. (And I'm doing P-90!) Also, there was a strange smell the first few times we used it. I don't smell it anymore, but I may have gone nose-blind to it.
On the upside, it does look nice.
I LOVE this kettle. It is incredibly easy to use (a monkey could figure it out) and it's beautiful! It's perfect for making tea and I have received many compliments on its behalf.

reviews.reviewTitle: The actual tea kettle is nice quality and is very pretty
reviews.reviewText: The actual tea kettle is nice quality and is very pretty. However, after having this kettle for only 2 months, the "on" switch wouldn't engage any more. The kettle has a limited one year warranty, so I called the company for a replacement. The customer service agent did confirm that this is an issue with this model, but they won't send out replacement parts. I had to mail in a receipt, a sticker from the bottom of the heating base, and cut off 2 inches of the cord (there was nothing wrong with the base until I did this), and mail it all to Canada, which cost over $10 in postage. I would recommend getting a different kettle all together, but if you absolutely are in love with the style, make sure to get the protection policy with it.

Love the design, and the fact that it’s ceramic, which is better than the stainless steel ones, that can be way too hot to the touch. The ease of using the kettle with the attachable base is a plus too, I can take it off and carry to wherever I need to pour my heated water. The water capacity is perfect also, would highly recommend.

reviews.reviewTitle: She likes it better than the original
reviews.reviewText: Bought this to replace one I broke (my fault). She likes it better than the original. This Bella brand seems to be really good quality. I've bought three of them now for the house and office. Heats fast. No corrosion after years of use. I like the ceramic ones better than the stainless steel ones. The stainless steel shows the spots and streaks after a while. The painted ceramic looks great after long term use...paint doesn't peel, face or rub off.

After I bought this kettle to use in my office, it had an odd leak for a while which seemed to come from the bottom of the spout. Almost returned it, but I kept stalling because it was perfect for me in looks and function other than that. Fast forward a few months, and the leak magically stopped! I now love this kettle so much I bought a second one for my kitchen at home (and the 2nd one has never leaked). Bumpy start, but this kettle is great!

This is THE BEST purchase we made in 2017!!! It is running 2-3 times a day and we use it for all our hot water needs. Tea, oatmeal, ramen, soup, etc!!!! I even bought one for my friend for Christmas after using it in our house for 2 weeks.
The kettle is heavy (because it’s ceramic) and my mom did have a hard time lifting it, but I love the solid feel

reviews.reviewTitle: LOVE it! Just bought my second one.
reviews.reviewText: We just purchased a second one (the first one shorted out about 5 great years, because I turned it on when it was empty. Don't try it !) We love how the while ceramic looks in the kitchen. Very nice to use, fast heating, easy to hold, handle does not get hot, nice capacity for about 6-8 cups of tea

reviews.reviewTitle: I love it. I wouldn't use an aluminum kettle so ...
reviews.reviewText: I've bought 4 of these.. I have one at my office and home and I've given a couple for gifts. I love it. I wouldn't use an aluminum kettle so I'm hooked on this.. heats the water fast. I think the first one I bought is about 5 years old now and I use it every day and it still looks new. The one down side is it's a little heavy when filled with water but I'd rather use a heavier kettle that isn't toxic aluminum any day.

We had a stainless steel kitchen aid electric kettle for years that finally stopped working. We bought another stainless stell electric kettle on Amazon that stopped working after 1-2 months. I ordered this kettle as a replacement and it seems much better made, and solid than the stainless steel ones. I like it, but it's very heavy even without water. I would not recommend it for an older person.

This is a great electric kettle for tea drinkers! It beats the water very quickly, turns off as soon as it’s done, and keeps the water hot for quite a while. It can be a bit noisy when in use, but a great alternative for those who don’t want a plastic kettle.

I love this tea kettle. It is so simple but functional. It heats water up in a few minutes and automatically shuts off which I like - it's nice not to have to worry about shutting it off especially if you're upstairs or at the other end of the house. My daughter got one for a gift, and I liked it so much I got one for our my husband and I. Highly recommend.

Use this product every day for my teas and could not be more pleased. No more microwave mess, just fill up, flip the switch and HOT water! This product does as expected. I have a BELLA coffer maker too and have come to love their products and reliability. I have two 600ml tea tumblers and the max line fills these both up perfectly! Would highly recommend for the daily tea drinker such as myself.

After reading some reviews I was a little reluctant to buy this kettle. I have been using it at least twice a day for two months and I love it! I'm glad I read those reviews because I knew ahead of time to be gentle with the kettle. It is a little heavy, but it work so well and it looks amazing on my coffee hutch! Very happy with this purchase. I'll be buying again for gifts.

reviews.reviewTitle: Beautiful Kettle but had too many problems..
reviews.reviewText: I had a cracked lid handle when it arrived. The 2nd one lasted 3 weeks and then the on off switch had problems. I would press down to turn on 7-10 times before it actually locked in and started to boil. I sent the 2nd one back and will not buy again.z

reviews.reviewTitle: Very modern yet sophisticated look. Gets a bit rusty if water is sitting. Easy to clean.
reviews.reviewText: The looks are very sophisticated. Gets a bit rusty when water is left at the bottom. Easy to clean. Great material. A bit heavy but very solid and it has a great capacity for water. Overall very awesome and I would definitely recommend! If you found this review useful please hit the helpful button so I’ll know to do more reviews. Thanks!

Love this tea kettle. Does exactly what we need it to. The only unfortunate part is that there is only one area for the cord to escape under the base, so either you have a bunch of leftover electric cord on your counter, or the kettle needs to be right exactly near the plug. Not enough to make me return it, and it works great. Just a little annoying.

I have been using this several times a day for several months now, and it's working great. I read some complaints about a weird smell - never had a problem. It's a little heavy, but you get used to it, and I like that it feels solid. The little blue light is nice to tell if it's on, and I like being able to flip the switch to cancel. It looks nice on the counter, too.

I have purchased this product twice now.

For the first time, I owned the kettle for a year and half and it was a wonderful purchase with which I never had issues. I had to move and leave it behind with a friend, so I bought a new one in my new home.

The second one lasted 2 months before it stopped turning off automatically. I decided to continue using it because I had loved the first one so much. Now, 5 months after purchase, it doesn't turn on anymore.

This is a hit and miss purchase. I always got compliments on the kettle, it looks very nice on the counter. Maybe you'll get lucky with a kettle that lasts a few years, and maybe you won't be so lucky.

We had a kettle like this (different design) for about 2 years. Loved it!!! Grandchildren could use it safely, we used it for everything! The spout got broken when someone hit it on something, we were so sad. I looked all over for a replacement and finally googled. we didn't remember the name Bella. Ordered this one, it came right away and everyone is happy again. It heats the water really fast, the bottom stays cool, so I can take it to the table without worrying about where to sit it. Grandchildren make oatmeal, I make tea, everyone makes their own things. As I've seen mentioned, this is ceramic, so there's no "plasticy" or metal smell. The only reason I didn't give 5 stars is because I don't know why different designs are different prices. Also, it is a little bit heavy when full, but we do solve that by putting the loop handle on the lid perpendicular to the spout so we can put a finger there while pouring to keep it from being so heavy on the pouring wrist!
Bottom line --- this will always be an absolute necessity in our house!!! Everyone should have this bella!!

reviews.reviewTitle: Please calm down... The smell goes away.
reviews.reviewText:
A lot of the one-star reviews I read for this product complain (in some cases vehemently) about the bad smell emanating from the silicon ring that seals the lid to the base of the kettle. This was very off-putting to me, as I am particularly sensitive to smell and my wife and I were looking in particular for an electric kettle that did not have plastic parts. After weighing the bulk of the positive reviews against this complaint, I decided to purchase the kettle and see for myself.

When it came out of the box, there was an easily detectible odor to the silicon seal. It was a very pungent chemical smell, but not so powerful that you could detect it from across the room or anything. You basically had to be standing over the thing to smell it. If you held the lid up to your face, it was quite strong, but we boiled a few pots of water to get the product primed and decided to see if it affected the taste of the water or the beverages we made from it. For the most part it did not.

Here's the thing that the one star reviews don't tell you because the reviewers didn't bother to find it out: The smell goes away. It is basically off-gassing from the brand-new food-grade silicon gasket. Like that "new car smell", once the off-gassing completes, the smell gradually dissipates and before you know it, it's completely gone. We've had our kettle for almost four months now, and I absolutely cannot detect even the slightest hint of that smell from the gasket anymore, even when I hold it right up to my nose and inhale deeply. It's gone.

This is a great kettle and by far the best plastic-free one you are likely to find anywhere. We love ours and use it constantly. If you are not so sensitive and can allow for a 45-day off-gassing period to wait out the gasket odor, I would not hesitate to buy this product and I recommend it enthusiastically.

This kettle is beautiful and so easy to use. The only downfall is that you cannot buy spare parts. I purchased one for my mom and she broke her lid. I tried calling customer service and they were no help. I couldn’t even find any online.

I bought this back in August 2015 (it's the end of December 2015 as I write this). The kettle stopped working. I press the on switch and there is no light and no heating takes place. I can't believe it just broke this quickly. I was very careful not to handle the kettle roughly and always set it down carefully.

I'm not really sure what can be done here. It might be too late for a refund/return.

This kettle has brought so much joy. I have used it every day for two and a half years and it has stood the test of time. The look is obviously beautiful, but it is also sturdy and dependable. I don’t feel it takes too long to boil, either. A worthy investment for this pretty pot.

I love this ceramic electric kettle! I have had a plastic electric kettle in the past, and purchased this one to get away from the plastic chemicals. almost all the mechanisms are metal or ceramic with the base being plastic and there is a rubber seal on the lid. The pattern is classy, the size is nice, and very simple to use. You can have got water in less than 5 minutes! The only downside is when you're pouring the hot water into a mug the outside of the kettle is hot and heavy which makes it difficult to hold onto.

I like that the interior of this kettle has no plastic and therefore the water does not have the plastic smell/odour. It is big enough to boil several cups of water. A little too loud but nothing too bothersome. And it looks good on the kitchen counter. 2 months in and so far so good

I had ordered another tea pot that was similar Amazon no longer carries. This pot is short and very heavy when full of water. Because of how short it is the pouring spout is not very long. When pot is full it's is heavy but do not hold or touch the spout to help support the pot. I have burned myself touching the spout and have burned myself with water from the spout. For me it's to heavy when full and I can't get it tipped fast enough so the water doesn't start to fun out on your hand or on counter. Only one level of heat and that is burning hot

reviews.reviewTitle: Faulty seal at the bottom of tea kettle
reviews.reviewText: Honestly, I bought this tea kettle because it looks so pretty on my countertop! Unfortunately, after six months of use, the seal of the bottom let go in the entire contents of the teapot ended up all over my countertop destroying my mail and everything else in its path. I would not recommend because there is no way I can return it at this point. I paid more because it was pretty… Now I have to go buy a new tea kettle… Again!

Looks very nice and it boils water.

Now the problems:

(1) this does not shut off automatically if water is low - can be dangerous

(2) creates white stuff -- need to need to clean frequently even we use filtered water.

I do not this product and would not recommend.

Thank you.

reviews.reviewTitle: STOPPED WORKING After 2 Months of Use!
reviews.reviewText: It worked great until it literally just STOPPED WORKING out of the blue. So frustrating. I will be contacting the manufacturer to see if we can get a replacement, but from reading the other reviews, looks like it'll probably be futile. Buy this product at your own risk, it's a gamble!

reviews.reviewTitle: This kettle is absolutely beautiful and very elegant
reviews.reviewText: This kettle is absolutely beautiful and very elegant. However, when full of boiling water (or indeed cold water) it is almost impossible to lift and pour safely. The spout is extremely hot and while you need it for balance, it would burn your hand if you tried to use it for stability. I hated to return it, but it is just not safe.

I don’t know how I lived without this kettle. From using for the right Temperature for different teas, to boiling a large amount of water for making pasta, or making pictures of ice tea. I want a ceramic kettle and I am so happy that I keep searching until I found the right one!

So I have this same pot, but it's about 7 years old and it has worked great. We are replacing it because the ceramic has become very stained inside. This is an exact replica, but the quality of production is much lower. The on/off toggle doesn't stay in position when I turn the pot on. Total bummer when you need hot tea in a polar vortex.

Too heavy. I wanted to like it, for the purity of ceramics and boiling water, has a single button to start and a non-hinged lid, but it was returned to weight plus water weight was a hazard for a home with elderly people. The quality is excellent, the pattern beautiful but it wasn't right for this home.

LOVE it! Water boils in approximately 7 minutes. Blue light switches on while coming to a boil. Makes a light clicking sound when done and blue light turns off.

Looks so pretty on the counter. It's heavy but pours SO NICELY. Doesn't drip/dribble all over. Feels durable and the lid closes tightly so you don't have to hold it while you pour.

I LOVE IT AND HIGHLY RECOMMEND IT!

reviews.reviewTitle: The minimum water amount is perfect for 1-2 people and maximum is perfect for 4-5 ...
reviews.reviewText: A little bigger than I expected but it is cuter than the picture in my opinion!!!! The minimum water amount is perfect for 1-2 people and maximum is perfect for 4-5 people. I got it for college since my room doesn't have a stove and it is perfect for that! So happy with my purchase!
Good product so far, had it for 3 weeks. Only draw back is the lid does not pop open, you have to manually open the top

Looks nice, seems well made, and works pretty quickly. I wish it held a little more water, because I have to fill it at least every other day and I'm the only one who uses it. I would also like it better if it would automatically shut off when you pick it up. Other than these two issues I really like this kettle. The colors are bright and the ceramic is so much better than my previous, mostly plastic kettle

reviews.reviewTitle: Waste of money - Looks pretty but quit working
reviews.reviewText: Stopped working suddenly in under 1 year of careful use. Purchased Sep 2017. The last electric kettle we had was a lot cheaper and worked for more than 5 years before I decided to get this because it had no plastic parts that came in contact with water. What a waste of money. We make so many purchases with Amazon and this is my first complaint. I wish Amazon offered a replacement or refund for selling an unreliable product.

I purchased this tea pot 03/27/2019 and as of today (09/16/2019) the tea pot will not come on.
I use sparingly (made 10-15 times total). 6 months of gentle use for it to go out? Totally unacceptable.

reviews.reviewTitle: We use it almost every day
reviews.reviewText: Sooo pretty!!!! I bought this because I was throwing a tea party themed baby shower and wanted to have hot water always available for the variety of teas that were served. It worked so well!!! I use it at home almost every day and love it so much, I even bought one for my mom-who also uses it almost every day. It has been more than two years since I purchased these kettles and they're worth every penny!!

I really liked this kettle but after some time I started to notice water on the counter around it. I thought I might be spilling it but then noticed that water was literally dripping from the side of the kettle. It appears there was a thin crack around the unit that allowed the water out.

Love the way it looks and pours, but benefits about end there. It takes as long to boil as an open pot on my old electric stove, so other than it being easier to pour from, I am seeing no real benefits from this $40 appliance. I am thinking I will try to return and get a higher wattage one next.
