-It's reaaaaaally easy to clean. I use filtered water to start to minimize the build up, but one boil with a water-vinegar solution makes it look like new anyway. I am never worried about rust or dirt because I treat it nice to begin with.
-The first one I had lasted for years and looked just as fresh and pretty as it did out of the box.
-Most of it is ceramic, so it minimizes the amount of plastic in your kitchen, if that's your thing (because it's mine).

CON
-My first one bit the dust after 5 years of heavy use (boiling MULTIPLE times a day). I just wished it lasted longer. I could have had a part replaced, but it ended up being cheaper and easier to reorder a new one from Amazon.
-It's heavier than a metal teapot, but honestly, I DON'T CARE. If you have feeble, old wrists, then maybe look at not using a ceramic pot that if you drop, it could break. But that's a choice you make when you buy something CERAMIC.
-Nothing else. I love it.

My best friend has had this kettle for many years. I always envied hers so when we relocated to a new home I saw my opportunity to have a nice cute kettle for the new house. It arrived on time, unbroken, brand new. No chips or scratches. I was a little worried that I may open a box to broken pieces. Or that after a few times of using it I would find a crack in the handle or lid. So far it is still in one piece and works just as a kettle should, only it looks cuter than a regular kettle. I have only had it for a week and we have made tea a more than a few times so I am pretty happy with it. One thing would be a suggestion to the sellers/manufacturers- make more designs! There are just way too few designs and I went with the blue one as it was the closest to my decor theme. Cactus print/ palm tree print/ different patterns and colours- Your kettle is in demand- make more designs! :)

I’ve had my Bella for about a month now and I use mine several times a day. I love the way that it looks on the counter. The design is beautiful and stylish. I like how the cord wraps around the bottom so you don’t have to have the cord hanging out all over the counter if you don’t need it. The turn off feature is nice as well. I wish that it was a little bigger. I feel like it doesn’t hold that much water to the fill line, although it claims to heat 1.2 L. Like other reviewers have said once it heats up you can’t get the top off until it cools down. This isn’t an extremely big deal for me. Also a thought to add its ceramic so you can’t add cold water to a hot pitcher or you may experience cracking. The other issue that others may have is that this pot is really heavy. It’s ceramic so I expected it to weigh more than my steel pot but it’s heavier then I anticipated. It wouldn’t be good for someone with weak wrists or the elderly.

reviews.reviewTitle: How did I ever live without this?!
reviews.reviewText: This electric tea kettle is my favorite purchase in a long time! It heats up super fast and clicks itself off after. It's absolutely gorgeous on my counter and I love how you can feel/see its quality. I'm currently sick and have been using it non-stop, and am so grateful for the convenience and usefulness of this lovely kettle. Highly recommended!

reviews.reviewTitle: Lasted a year, very heavy/bulky but was pretty while it lasted
reviews.reviewText:
Update: it’s been exactly a year since I bought this kettle, I gave it a 4 at first but changed it because the kettle has started to leak water everywhere. As nice as it looks, it hasn’t lasted more than a year so loses 2 stars.

2018 review:
As much as I love how this item looks, it’s HEAVY. And it gets heavier once you fill it all the way up. I’ve given it a 4 because it looks great and gets the job done. I use it everyday as I’m an avid morning tea drinker and so is the rest of my family. We use it everyday sometimes several times a day and it has worked well every time and boils the water quickly. I just wish it was lighter and made 7 cups instead of 4/5 per cup amount (if you fill the entire kettle to max).

reviews.reviewTitle: My favorite thing about this kettle is that it is ceramic
reviews.reviewText: This tea kettle is a beauty sitting on the kitchen counter. My favorite thing about this kettle is that it is ceramic! I have had this kettle for over a month. It boils quickly and I absolutely love the shut off feature when it has reached a full boil- no worries that it will continue boiling and boil dry. The handle is overly large for my liking when handling the kettle to pour but it does help keep your hand away from the heat. It is a bit heavy when filled with water, so I wouldn't recommend it for an older person as it can be cumbersome to hold and pour with the weight. Other than that, I am very satisfied with this kettle and use it every day.

reviews.reviewTitle: Entire Bottom Cracked After One Year
reviews.reviewText:
This kettle was amazing, and I used it about 3-4 times a week. I made sure to fill it to at least the "minimum" line, and it worked well up until about a year after purchase. When I turned it on, I kept noticing droplets of water on the outside of the kettle, almost like it was weeping. Apparently at some point a crack formed around the entire circumference of the bottom of the kettle, causing water to leak out.

Unfortunately this makes it completely useless, and it's not exactly a cheap kettle. I would have expected better quality and for it to last longer. Up until that point, it worked well, looked beautiful, and did everything I needed it to.

Just a shame that it broke!

Love this tea kettle. Heats up at average speed, the design is so cute for my kitchen, and the pour is really nice because there's no dripping/spilling or over-pouring possible. My one complaint, and I negated a star because, it doesn't hold that much liquid - maybe 5 cups total. I think a lot of tea kettles hold way more. but I am a single person so it's no biggie and works fine for me.
A tip - some people say it takes time to get the plastic-y toxic smell out of it - but just wash it with some dish soap (making sure not to get it on the bottom, obviously) and water and it goes away immediately. I've had no problems since I did that.

I’ve had this for over a month. I love it. I was going to go with a more tech fancy one but realized the cuteness of my coffee cups drive me. This heats up to a boil within 6-7 min (sooner if you don’t fill all the way up). Notice I said BOIL, so you can’t drink immediately. I let it steep my teabag until it’s ready. My favorite thing is the appearance. Absolutely adorable and looks so cute in my kitchen. It’s a thick ceramic so I’m very careful when filling up in sink. I wish it stayed on at a drinkable level for an hour or so after it boils so I could get multiple cups without turning back on. Love the 360 degree base. Another critic is the cord and base. Not weighted so cord can actually flip it over if you store your cord under (no retraction, just wraps under...which I don’t do). Overall, love it and wouldn’t trade it for a tech one due to the appearance.

This kettle is not only beautiful, but also very efficient.

Pros:
-Gorgeous design
-Easy to use
-Heats water up quickly
-Sturdy
-Has lines to mark the minimum and maximum amount of water

Cons:
-A bit on the heavy side, but that's because it's ceramic and well- built
-Sides get hot (obviously) when water heats up, so you can only hold it on the handle and/or base

Overall, I LOVE this kettle and have received many compliments on it!

This kettle looks great on my counter and boils much faster than our stovetop kettle. It is a little heavy, but not so heavy that it's uncomfortable or difficult to use. I kind of like the weight of it--you can tell it is well-made, not cheap. I like that it has a blue light that turns off when it is ready, and I like that it turns itself off automatically--that's a good safety feature. We do use it at least twice a day, sometimes more, and it has held up to that level of use so far, but we haven't had it too long yet so I can't really speak to long-term durability. We've had exactly zero problems with it. So far, very happy with this purchase!

It looks very elegant, high quality paint, and keeps the heated water hot for a long while (porcelain). That was important to me. Be aware that the kettle is heavy with water in it even half full. I didn’t expect that. You want to grab the HOT spout, too, if lifting the handle, too. Now that I know, I will use a pot mitt, or heat less at a time.

Has a top fill line that is 3/4 up to top - be aware of that. Some reviews talked about it leaking, and I think they filled it too full. I have had no leaks. The top lid is tight silicone.

reviews.reviewTitle: Well-made product that looks nice in my kitchen!
reviews.reviewText: I have a history of buying kitchen items and then regretting it later because we don't use them enough to justify the counter or cupboard space that they occupy. I am happy to say that this is not one of those purchases! I really like the style of this electric kettle and the quality of the materials. It is very easy to clean. I love that it is made of ceramic and metal rather than plastic. It is heavier than the cheap electric kettles I have used in the past, but the superior quality is definitely worth the weight difference. It's still easy to lift and pour, and is much lighter than some of the kitchen items that I use on a daily basis (cast iron anyone?). We have been using the kettle multiple times a day and it looks the same as when I took it out of the box. So far, I am really pleased with it.

I have been searching for a decent electric tea kettle for months. I wanted something that had no plastic inside, looked decent, and was reasonably priced. This Bella kettle fit the bill and then some. It is really quite attractive, has no plastic inside (this has been almost impossible to find, even when a manufacturer claims there is no plastic), and heats the water rapidly. The lid does have a silicone seal to keep it tightly in place, but that works for me. I’ve used this numerous times since I got it and am thrilled with the purchase.

This works perfectly. Hot water, fast. I gave it 2 stars because it's difficult to actually use. It's very heavy but you can't use 2 hands to pour it because every part of it except the handle is just as hot as the water inside. I guess I'll wear an oven mitt whenever I pour a cup. There's no way my kids can use it to make hot cocoa, which was at least half of why I bought it. I suppose I could have returned it but I'd rather suffer than deal with the hassle.

reviews.reviewTitle: Gorgeous! No plastic! Have high hopes!
reviews.reviewText:
(Feb 2017) This kettle is even more stunning in person, so glad I purchased it. I specially like that there is no plastic on the inside which was something really important to me. I really like where the switch is and how minimal the light output is while boiling. A huge plus that it is some serious eye candy on my counter! I went ahead and purchased the Square trade warranty for around $5 for four years, that is worth the money for me to have a kettle that works for that long!

Will update review if there are any developments!

This is a great electric kettle for only $35! I purchased the blue pattern because I like how it looks but it was also a bit cheaper. I have a Keurig 2.0 that is 3 years old and it doesn't make my drinks as hot as it used to. The keurig is also very loud while it's heating and dispensing water. I love having tea at night but don't like waking everyone up because of the Keurig. I decided to get an electric kettle instead of a stove top kettle because I don't like the pot whistling.
The pot is a bit shorter and wider than I anticipated but it still fits nicely on the counter. It's easy to use and easy to clean. It takes 5 minutes for the water to heat and the switch to release up and into the off position. I like to wipe off any remaining water and store with the lid off.

Bella is very well made and so stylish that I actually got both the Blue Aztec and Silver Tile and gift one away. It's the right size for making 4 mugs of tea before needing to refill the tank. To prevent forming sediments, I use water from my fridge dispenser that has a filter. I throw away the silicon around the lid the second I opened the package. Just put your hand on the lid when pouring, and there's no need for a sealed silicon ring ever. However, there's another silicon seal on the bottom inside the kettle that cannot be removed. After making 10 cups, I no longer could taste any plastic though. There's also a white plastic piece on top of the vertical overflow pipe, and I lost it when I was washing my kettle. It dropped into the garbage disposal, but I guess it's not an important piece, and less plastic is better inside boiling water!

reviews.reviewTitle: Not functional, defective, and smells like toxic material inside.
reviews.reviewText:
This is such a pretty kettle! However, just as many many others noticed, it smells funny inside (plastic and metal smell, and maybe glue? Basically- something very toxic and strong).
This particular kettle had a couple of dark brown spots on it's side (defect in the ceramic) and a chip in the ceramic at the bottom. I tried to 'accept it' as is with its imperfections and boiled the first batch of water, as they reccomend, before using the kettle. This did NOT get rid of the plastic/toxic smell at all and left some dark spots on the metal plate inside after just this one boil. It looked like rust (brownish color). I should have listened to the bad reviews before ordering, but was too intrigued/attracted by the design of this item. Two stars because the design is so nice, but 1 star for overall functionality and questionable materials used. I ordered another design for a friend. The product was not packaged in the shipping box and the product box was full of holes, dirt and was completely beat up and horrible looking. I can't give this as a gift! I checked quickly inside and the kettle was all dusty and had a chip in the ceramic as well. It also had the toxic smell and the metal disk inside looked scratched. I returned both of them right away.
We have used the Japanese brand 2 L boiler for 17 years now (Zajirushi). The first one died after 11 years and the current one is still going. I was looking for a prettier design look and the ceramic sounded much better than whatever Zajirushi has inside of it. At least the one we have now never smelled like toxic glue or plastic and I think it has only stainless steal inside...Will keep on looking...

After buying several electric kettles on Amazon and having them wear out, I decided to purchase another one at a higher price point to see if the quality would improve. So far I have been VERY impressed with the kettle. It doesn't leak, it heats the water thoroughly and quickly and the water stays heated for more than one cup of tea. Because it is ceramic it can be heavy but other than that it's the best electronic kettle I've had in the past 5 years! I hope it continues to work as well as it does.

reviews.reviewTitle: Had it many months works wonderful!! Use it daily
reviews.reviewText: Purchased the bella 1.2 with with the Moroccan silver tile look. Before buying this I read a lot of the reviews, A few people said there’s broke easily, or the outside looked like it was breaking or cracking or crackling. I have had mine many months now and use mine at least once a day… I have not had any problems with mine. When needed I hand wash, never put in the dishwasher. It has worked great warms up quickly, I have not had any trouble and it is super pretty. I leave it on my counter because it is so pretty. I wanted to leave a review because mine works very well and I have not had any problems, but I take good care of it as well. Happy customer

Oh gosh I love this ceramic kettle!!!!! Love love love it!!! Is so darn easy to use!!! And the cutest thing in my kitchen!!! Heats the water really fast and love that it just shuts off once the water is hot. And u can take it off the base and settle it anywhere bc the bottom has a little leg thing that doesn't let it flush it to the bottom where u put it. I use it mostly for tea but I have used it for oatmeal and one time for eggs since the water boils much quicker here than the pan. Love it!! And I bought the blue one for my mother in law bc she's a tea lover as well and she didn't even want to use it bc it looks so cute, she did and she's happy with it Lol very effective and great design!!

I had a previous model of the Bella Ceramic Kettle and loved it. It lasted me 5 years before I knocked it against the sink and cracked the spout. So on my quest to look for a new kettle, I found Bella now made one that has temperature control and a keep warm function. Awesome. Received it yesterday and love the way it boils quietly and beeps when done, less than 10 mins. Tried the keep warm function and it basically continues to reboil when the water temperature drops which I do not like, wished it was more like a warming plate. Also, I found this ceramic kettle has some silicone plastic sealer inside on the bottom of the stainless steel (see photo). So for those who are trying to avoid plastic, you may want to avoid this kettle. Overall, I do love this kettle. It looks sleek and is easy to use. Hopefully, this will last me another 5 years or more.

I've been in search of a copper electric kettle and found this. I love it! It's a beautiful addition to my kitchen, like a work of art. The pictures of it don't do the color justice.

This kettle has a beautiful shape and copper color, and the LED band around the bottom portion lights up in blue, which makes it easy to see when the kettle is heating the water.

It takes about 7 minutes to boil a full kettle of water and it stays hot for a good amount of time.

No problems with leaking, and we've filled it to the max line.

Before buying I noticed some reviews saying it was heavy and took a long time to boil. I tested just now, and when filled to the Max line with tap water at room temperature it took 6 minutes and 6 seconds to boil, which to me seems longer than some I've used when traveling. Filled to the Max with water it weighed 6.6 lbs on my bathroom scale, which does seem heavy, but manageable for me. I have the 1.2 liter model, so the larger one might be very heavy. On the plus side, the ceramic is very attractive.
I would like to have it make a sound when it finishes boiling. The tab snaps up, but very quietly, so if I'm busy with other things I may not notice it's done.

reviews.reviewTitle: DO NOT PURCHASE Stopped working after 6 months
reviews.reviewText: Don't order this unless you only need to use this for half a year. I only used it to heat up water for tea and for my babies formula. You can believe I was left extremely annoyed that one day I'm trying to warm up the water and it won't turn on. I'm thankful my husband had a little one. Otherwise it would have been a real mess. I've only been using it for 6 months and I'm very disappointed. Other than that it worked and looked great and was easy to wipe clean.

I love this thing. It heats up the water so fast, in about two minutes you are ready to go! The size is much bigger than I anticipated and it was a pleasant surprise. It looks so cute in my kitchen and when I'm not using it I keep it on display on the counter because it's just so freaking pretty. The little switch to turn it on or off is well made and easy to use, it does shit off automatically when it's done heating up so keep in mind it's not going to keep your pot warm all day but the fact it heats up in 2 minutes make it no big deal. It is fragile so be careful, I banged it against the sink by accident and nothing happened! I got the silver one because it was the cheaper one and I'm so happy with my choice. The silver one looks sooooo much better in person. I just don't understand why the other colors are more expensive??? And the turquoise one is even going for double the price! That's just crazy. Buy this, it's awesome. I'm thinking of gettting one for my momma.

My kettle arrived two days ago, and it is beautiful and very sturdy. However, the button is faulty and won't stay down in order for the water to heat. This means I have to stay next to the kettle during the entire heating process to continually press down the button when it pops up prematurely. I had previously been using a glass larger model by a different brand, and while it was more of an eyesore, it worked much better.

I wish I didn't throw away the box so I could just return it!

Love this! Purchased the white with quatrefoil in silver, and it's gorgeous on the outside and works really, really well. I love how sturdy it feels. Takes about 45-60 seconds to heat up water, depending on how full it is.
In spite of my happiness with it, I would warn you that it's heavy. Like, really heavy. This is not something that my grandmother could have handled with her strength level and her arthritis. The lid also has a gasket that would have made removal difficult for her.

reviews.reviewTitle: Doesn’t heat up water hot enough
reviews.reviewText: I bought a “used, like new” and usually have good luck with those. Although this tea kettle arrived dirty and it does not work properly. The water doesn’t heat up enough to make tea. This was a gift for my parents and they are very unhappy with it & I am so disappointed. Wish I could return or exchange but the return window is closed.

reviews.reviewTitle: I love this. It is beautiful
reviews.reviewText: I love this. It is beautiful, works exactly like I wanted it to. It heats up the water quickly, it's very simple to use, and looks gorgeous on my counter. It was larger than I was expecting it to be. Highly recommend this kettle.

I bought this electric kettle in April 2018 so it's been a little over a year and the kettle cracked right above the switch to turn it on/off. very disappointed because I did love it and used it almost everyday for six months.

original: Works great, heats water fast and just beautiful! It's even prettier in real life. I liked it so much I bought my MIL one in a different design. Only complaint would be that you have to fill it up at a minimum 2 cups for it to work. My Krups does not need this and will heat even the smallest amount of water. I take off the rubber around the top to clean it. Happy to not have metallic tasting water anymore!

I bought this for a Christmas exchange since it was reasonably priced and one of those things that you don't normally buy for yourself. I ended up buying one for my home as well, and although I thought it was an extra luxury item it ended up being one of the things I treasure most in the morning is a nice cup of herbal tea. This ceramic kettle heats up super fast and the water is incredibly hot. It actually reaches boiling level so once you pour it in your cup give it a few minutes to cool down. One of my favorite features is the auto shut off since I am forever forgetting to turn things off. I keep this on my counter 24/7 because it is adorable to look at. I know an "adorable" tea kettle but this one just is.

reviews.reviewTitle: I get so many compliments on this kettle at work ...
reviews.reviewText: I get so many compliments on this kettle at work! If you're looking for something "old fashioned" but still modern enough to heat up within 3 minutes, this is the kettle for you! It is very heavy and well made. The bottom doesn't get that hot so I can leave it on my desk at work and have hot tea whenever I want. It's also extremely quiet and no one else in the office can hear the water boiling. The design is so much nicer than those plastic electric kettles too!

reviews.reviewTitle: Good looking , easy to use and sturdy
reviews.reviewText:
I have another color and love it so much I bought this for a friend. Everyone admires how it looks and it is very easy to use.
We have hard water , so I use the filtered water and don't let water sit in it to avoid any build up. The handle does not get
Hot and although my hands are weak some days I can hold the handle easily to pour. It may be too heavy for frail hands
As it is a solidly built item.. But stove top kettles splash and many other styles of electric ones have plastic parts inside. I was using the all
metal Kitchen Aid model but it continually stopped working as the interior wires would oddly seperate. A fix is possible ( search on line )
But after the third time , I decided to give this a try. It is really great. Looks nice and the prices go down often.

Love this kettle so far. The lid can be a little snug, so have to really tug to get it out, but I think that's the point. I had a Bella kettle for 8 years before this one, it lasted through 4 moves, and got dropped on the 5th move when the box opened at the bottom. My point is, this is a quality product if treated with care. The design is beautiful and I'm frequently complimented on it. Very happy with my purchase.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great teapot with no metallic taste.
reviews.reviewText: We had always used a metal tea pot and it was not until we were visiting relatives that we noticed how much better tea tastes in a ceramic pot. We ordered the Bella and love the lack of metallic taste in our tea. My only complaint is that the inside markings for max and min fill are only on one side. Being left handed I have to hold the pot by the spout when filling to see how much water to add. It is also too bad it does not come in solid black.

This tea kettle isn't exactly what I was imagining. It is way bigger than I thought it would be! It's almost as big as my coffee maker. I look like a child trying to lift a tea pot when I hold it. It's also very heavy. My main complaint is that the lid is really hard to get off. I wish it was a flip lid. Every time I get it off it's like I win a tug-of-war. My only really good comment is that it's pretty. I like the way it looks. But I have had other electric kettles in the past that seem to heat quicker and are way smaller and lightweight.

Was very sad when my 14-yo Krups kettle died, and was initially looking for something similar to replace it, but decided to give this ceramic one a try since I guess current medical advice is to avoid cooking food in plastic anymore. I've been using it daily for a couple weeks now and it works exactly as anticipated, similar boil time and auto shut-off. It is heavier than a plastic kettle - but it's far better looking. Another advantage I noticed is that the way the lid is sealed and the spout is shaped, there is far less steam emitted from the top of the kettle while it's boiling. Glad to have found this and hope it lasts as long as my last one!

I wanted to like this product, it’s really attractive. However, mine started leaking out the bottom until it rids itself of all water stored inside, making a mess of my counter. I wanted to discuss this issue with the manufacturer, however, due to return policy guidelines, I’m past the window of getting a return. Purchase with extreme caution; mine is useless to me and I’ve only had it a couple months

So elegant and sturdy! Absolutely love this!!!!!!! The lid seals with a snug fit but still easy to take off. Very fast and love how I can be getting ready in the mornings for work and it hardly take any extra time for me to turn on, heat up and have my travel mug ready to go by the time I leave. Even great for other things such as heating water for a boil for pasta and oatmeal for my sons breakfast.

I purchased this for my wife in June 2017. We have used it almost every day since. This morning we noticed a small, hairline crack in the enamel. It doesn't go all the way through, so it doesn't leak, but it's VERY disappointing. We have never dropped it, or bumped it and always treated it with care. We think this was caused by the constant use of heating and cooling. It's really disappointing as this was a gift for my wife and only lasted a little over a year.

I bought one after I saw that my sister had one. I love it! I've had it at least two years, no fading or chipping of design. It heats quickly. It is a little heavy, but I love how it looks on the counter top! I bought the red one for my mother last year, she still uses it.

Pros:
It is very attractive. Looks really good on the counter.
Really easy to clean the exterior.
Cons:
Pretty limited capacity. Max fill is about 4.5 cups.
Pretty slow to bring water to boil. My previous tea kettle heated water super fast. This one is just barely faster than using stovetop.
HEAVY! This thing weighs a ton, making it awkward to hold.

reviews.reviewTitle: Not the quickest to boil but it just works well.
reviews.reviewText: I've had this thing for about 3 years now and it's never given me any problems. I've never had an electric kettle last more than 2 years ever so I am really impressed by this thing! The two sorta of downsides are it's a pretty small kettle and it takes a lot longer than other kettles to actually boil. Not deal breakers because all of those other quicker ones seem to have a higher failure rate. (at least in my experience)

reviews.reviewTitle: Great for Tea and French Press Coffee
reviews.reviewText:
I've had it for a week and I already don't know how I've lived so long without it. It looks great on the counter and doesn't take up any real space. It heats up extremely quickly especially compared to a stovetop kettle. My only complaint is that it doesn't really alert you when it's done. The blue light goes off but there's no sound. Honestly though, it heats up so fast and stays hot for so long that generally I'm already in the kitchen when it's done or I don't even notice it's already done.

Other than that it's absolutely perfect.

There are a couple life changing products I've purchased recently and this is one of them. Don't be daunted by the price, we'll save that in wasted electricity and gas this year. Just the right temperature, ceramic, looks good on the counter top. Fill it up, touch the switch and in very little time, less than waiting for the tea kettle on the stove to whistle, you have hot water. From there, sky is the limit. Tea, Hot Cocoa, pre-made STXBX latte, mocha latte all quickly and easily. Guess what's going out for holiday gifts!!

I use this to heat the water for my French press. Love the style (color) and the look, super cute and functional. Great design with the flip button that turns it on or off (it lights up blue and has an automatic shut-off). Mine didn't really have a chemical smell to it like others stated but when it came I still heated a couple pots of water in it before I used any for coffee. It holds a good amount of water and is easy to pick up and pour. And once again, it looks great in my kitchen.

reviews.reviewTitle: It looks and works great. Doesn't get a 5-star because of a design ...
reviews.reviewText: It looks and works great. Doesn't get a 5-star because of a design flaw in the lid. the entire lid is breakable, and the small round ring at the top seems very fragile, as was proven by the first one we received went back because it came broken. minus the lid, it's great... but if you break that little fragile ring at the top, it's basically ruined because the whole unit is an aesthetic piece.

This has been an excellent hot water pitcher. It's a bit heavy to hold when full, but heats quickly and completely. The ceramic design is good looking, and holds the heat very well. The lid fits very well and remains tight when tipping to pour. We bought another for a gift. Finally we did all the research with the seller to be sure the materials from which the pot is made are toxic free. There are several colors to chose from to fit a particular decor. Highly fecommended

This water kettle is prettier than the pics. Helps to update my kitchen without changing something costly like a back splash. Compared to my old stainless kettle, it is about 45 seconds slower boil rate for a cuppa. It's also MUCH heavier! If buying for an elderly person, or someone with arthritis, I would choose something else.
I get lots of compliments on it! Not sure how long it will make it in a busy home with three kids tho. Heavy, and fragile!
But the pretty factor won me over! Lol

This tea kettle is very beautiful! Pretty copper color and very easy to use especially since I have it plugged into my echo Dot. I don't think I can change the temperature on it however. Maybe I just haven't used it enough to figure it out. But I am definitely satisfied.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great style but has some issues
reviews.reviewText:
I was excited to get this because of the unique and beautiful design that can easily be left out on our kitchen island bar. I also love anything ceramic and heavy as it tends to be higher quality and last longer in our house.

It has worked out well for our French press coffee/tea needs and boiling water for cleaning bucket. I do see an issue with the metal & plastic but haven't had any residual taste issues so far.

The biggest problem we have had is the bottom is metal and it causes major calcium buildup that takes steel wool to scrub off and some of the buildup cannot be reached. We also make sure to take the lid off and place it sideways to allow airflow when not in use as it started to grow a small amount of mold on the silicone seal around the lid the first week in use.

reviews.reviewTitle: Cute and boils my water just fine.
reviews.reviewText: I just purchased a new home and at my parents house we used the kettle all the time for making tea or boiling water for a pot. I didn't want to spend a time of money so when I saw this one on sale, I snatched it. It looks nice on my kitchen counter and use it several times a week with no problems. Will buy again!

Such a pretty item for the kitchen!! I love it! It's a bit heavy in comparison to typical plastic electric kettles, but the overall design makes up for it. (Also, a bit smaller than what I had used in the past but we've learned to live with just filling it up more frequently.)

This was our first electric tea kettle (we usually had stovetop) and I must say we have fallen in love. We have gotten compliments on the design (silver and white trellis/mosaic looking one). It is louder than I expected but it just sounds like simmering water. It automatically turns off once the water is heated which is nice. It also doesn't take up too much space on the counter which is another plus. Very glad I got this.

I LOVE how this looks in my kitchen. It is glass on the inside instead of plastic and it boils the water just like it is s supposed to. I am so happy that I got such a high quality and beautiful product for such a great price. I highly recommend.

I received this teapot as a Christmas gift 3 years ago and have used it constantly. This year I bought one for my best friend for Christmas and she loves hers as much as I do mine. The blue color is a beautiful shade of blue. Looks lovely sitting on the counter everyday. The teapot is easy to handle and the water heats quickly.

reviews.reviewTitle: Attractive and very functional tea kettle
reviews.reviewText: I bought this ceramic tea kettle to replace an old water heating system I had for a while. This kettle is attractive, sturdy, and generally seems well made. It heats up the water I need for my oatmeal in 2-4 minutes. One word of caution would be that the kettle is a little bigger than I was expecting, so finding a good space in your kitchen to store it can be a challenge. I'm leaving it on our countertop since it is attractive and there isn't enough space elsewhere. I have no complaints.

reviews.reviewTitle: ... this kettle for 6 months now and I still love it. I wanted something that wasn’t thin glass ...
reviews.reviewText: I’ve had this kettle for 6 months now and I still love it. I wanted something that wasn’t thin glass or plastic. This boils water quick enough for me and hold plenty of water. It look great on my counter. The only reason why I’m not giving 5 stars is because I had to have another delivered after the first one came with a crack in the handle on the lid. It’s not something I’m super worried about breaking it is pretty sturdy but I can see how it can break in transport if handled incorrectly.

reviews.reviewTitle: So far so good. I've been using it for a month
reviews.reviewText:
So far so good. I've been using it for a month. I love the look of this Bella on my countertop. It gets daily use and regular comments from visitors to my home. Word of caution - it is heavy when it's full. Even as a young-ish woman, I sometimes struggle to lift it and pour. But I'd definitely prefer this over the cheap, plastic kettles that our local big box store is peddling.
I've had no issues with bad smells, after-taste or slow heating times.

I bought my first one for home, loved it so much I bought a second one for work. I had it first in my office, and now I moved it into the lunchroom for everyone to use. It's so easy to use, and it boils water quickly for soups, teas, etc. It's sturdy for often used and classically designed.
Love this product and I highly recommend it.

reviews.reviewTitle: Very Disappoingting that the little knob showing the LED light stopped working after 4 months,
reviews.reviewText: It has only been 5 months and the on/off button has stopped working. I can hold the button down manually, while the water heats up. but that is not how it should work. I have not used this tea pot very much so I was really surprised when the little knob that shows the LED light stopped working. The automatic shut off stopped working as well. Very disappointing.

I purchased this kettle to replace and old one that did not survive my long distance move. Since I loved my old one, I paid the money to purchase a new one by the same company. I would give it 5 stars but the base, the heating element, survived only one use sadly. It would no longer work. Good thing I didn’t toss the old base as I would be without a kettle and have to go through the refund process.

I wanted an electric tea kettle, but I don't really like the metal ones. This one is great because it is ceramic and just looks more traditional. That said, it is WAY BIGGER than I thought it would be. I still love it, but for some reason I had imagined a cute little dainty teapot and this is much more clunky than that. Still glad I got this one over a metal one!

UPDATE - 10/17/2018 - Still love this kettle. No issues with it and its been 3+ years now. About to purchase a 2nd one for my office

reviews.reviewTitle: Adore this kettle, but VERY heavy
reviews.reviewText: Love love love. This tea kettle is gorgeous and adds to my kitchen's look. However, it's not for the weak. The ceramic makes it quite a bit heavier than I expected (I'm a fit 30-something, FWIW), and because the exterior gets really hot you must be able to hold it in one hand (or have an oven mitt on the other). Will enjoy more tea and instant bevvies than ever now. No annoying whistle, and no fear of burning the house down.

reviews.reviewTitle: Rubber used at the bottom to seal the heating plate
reviews.reviewText: They used a rubber to seal the gap between the heating plate and the kettle itself. Every time you boil the water, you are essentially boiling the rubber as well. The water smells and tastes funny afterwards. I was really mad after taking a really close look at the bottom of the kettle.

I have used this tea kettle daily since early October 2017 to make my morning instant coffee, and at other times for tea. I have not had one problem with it. Automatic shut off when water is reaches the boiling point. This is very sturdy, fashionable, and heats water quickly. If it ever does quit working, I will buy another. High quality!

reviews.reviewTitle: THIS IS AWESOME TEAPOT. I use it everyday
reviews.reviewText: THIS IS AWESOME TEAPOT. I use it everyday. I use good water (not tap - bottled/ only) and the only think I do every couple uses is to rinse it and take a paper towel and wipe bottom of pot for residue build-up. it is worth every penny and one of my favorite items I have purchased for myself

I use this kettle at work for tea/coffee. Its very nicely designed and I get lots of compliments on it when patients see it. Its professional looking, boils just the right amount of tea and gives me lots of time to boil water while busy at work. I am very thankful for this kettle!

Literally two days after the return period expired, it stopped working! I loved it when it actually heated up water, but now, I guess I'll have to go through some lengthy return process.
P.S. After calling the company in Montreal, Canada, I followed their return instructions, costing $9.50 to myself. Now I am just waiting...

I love this water kettle. I get kids of compliments on this. I have often this to two friend also and they have lived this so much! Works great and I haven’t had any issues with it. It is however on the heavier side but very well made and totally worth it.

reviews.reviewTitle: Best plastic free option I've found so far
reviews.reviewText: I spent so much time looking for a plastic free option and finally found my favorite! I tried a few glass ones, but they always have plastic pieces in the top. It has a seal in the lid, but it looks like silicone.

I have had one for 2 years. I love it, we never go a day without using it at least once. I broke the ceramic handle off the lid in a freak accident where i basically threw it across the room (butter fingers). Loved it so much I purchased the same one to replace it. Super happy with how well its held up for years.

reviews.reviewTitle: Pretty design and works very well
reviews.reviewText: I LOVE this. It is beautiful, heats up quickly and holds a decent amount. It is heavy but unless you are really weak or perhaps up there in years, I really don't think its a problem for day to day use. I'm not exactly strong and don't have a problem with it. It is beautiful on my counter and I receive tons of compliments on it (which is what everyone is really after right?)

Way too heavy. Not bad I suppose if you want an arms workout every time you use it to make a nice relaxing tea... 🤔 It is pretty but it arrived with several imperfections I could not overlook. Return went smoothly.

reviews.reviewTitle: TEA Time and it is HOT!
reviews.reviewText: This is the greatest product. I loved it so much I told my sister about it and she ordered one. She loves it too! I drink more hot tea now, it is fast, easy and clean. The tea is very HOT!!! YOU will love it!

Ive had my kettle about a week and a half. This evening i noticed a puddle of water under the kettle and on top of the heating plate. I started to pour the water into my press and then noticed it was draining from the small holes on the bottom of the kettle. This just started tonight. Havent had a single issue beforehand. I dumped the water, dried the kettle off and then filled it 1/3 of the way up to test again. Leaking pretty good out of the holes. Im irritated. Who can I contact about getting my kettle replaced. Please.

reviews.reviewTitle: Excellent quality. Attractive and does the job.
reviews.reviewText: As beautiful as it is in the pictures. Can't believe the price for the quality! It looks and feels like a fairly expensive kettle, but I paid around $30 for it. The body of this ceramic kettle gets too hot to touch when heated and can be heavy if filled with water, so maybe avoid this one if weak or arthritic hands as you have to pour holding the handle only. We've used it daily for about 6 months and it's still going strong.

I wanted a ceramic kettle because there were no plastic pieces to melt and minimal metal to leach into the metal. I was not disappointed with this purchase. The water heats up quickly. During the summer, I bought the blue one to keep in my classroom. My husband was so upset when I took it away in August, we now have the silver one for our kitchen.

Stylish, Excellent Quality, and Efficient! It boils water for tea in what feels like two minutes! I’m incredibly impressed with this tea kettle! I absolutely despise clutter, especially in my kitchen but this is an item I leave out on the countertop. I find myself drinking more tea than usually because of the ease and simplicity of this product!
Love it! Takes like 5 minutes and is not loud at all. The design is what got me, now to order for all I know who are still using the whistle pots and coffee pota for tea 😀

It looks really beautiful. And I just got it today. Works well so far. I boiled some water in it first, spilled it out and the next one was for my tea. The tea tasted good, no rubbery taste or anything like that.

Very easy to use, easy to clean inside and wipe outside. We use it daily, several times per day! It also looks nice sitting on the counter and I have purchased multiples for gifts for my mom and friends. Great item for a wedding shower too!

I love this kettle. My mother in law had one and when I was in the market for one, it was at the top of my list. The only thing that can be tempermental is the lid. My mother in law's kettle has a very tight lid and mine is quite a bit looser. It's not bad and still works and heats up quite quickly. I would definitely recommend this if you are looking for a stylish and efficient kettle.

reviews.reviewTitle: Looks great, made well, large capacity
reviews.reviewText: The quality is top notch and the capacity is plenty for medium sized groups (4 or 5 people). My only noteworthy observation is it was quite heavy compared to stainless steel kettles, but I realize that's not that surprising since it is ceramic. The spout and overall appearance is a definite plus. Highly recommend.
Nice tea kettle; not junky looking. You can display it openly with pride. I was surprised how quickly it heats up water. Good valve. Would make a nice gift.

I really like this kettle. It heats super fast and I love the auto-off feature. I bought this for my office and it's the perfect size and really great quality, very well made. Definitely would purchase again.

Love my new kettle!!! It's super cute and I have received lots of compliments. Yes, it will rust if you leave water on it overnight over a long period of time but that's normal! If you take care of it and make sure you empty the water and pat dry it every night it will last a long time!

Heats water very quickly and stays hot for a while! Definitely worth the price!!!

wonderful kettle. slightly heavy but the water tastes really good. better than the the metal ones. replaced this for a Hamilton beach which caught rust after1 5 days of use.

update: It sadly stopped working after 8-9 months:( . thought it would last me a couple of years at least !

When I first saw this ceramic tea kettle on Amazon I absolutely fell in love. It's so chic and modern. After receiving the product it was even more gorgeous in person. It's heavy, especially when adding water but that's not an issue for me. I prefer ceramic, glass or stainless steel products over plastic. It's so easy to use. Just flip the switch on and it immediately starts the boiling process. Takes only 5 minutes to boil water and it turns itself off after it's done. So hoping it lasts a long time. Oooh and it looks fabulous on my kitchen counter...just sayin ;0)

Fantastic kettle, heats up water in a few minutes, and love that it’s on a swivel stand, the blue light is a nice touch too, turns off when the water is at boiling point. Looks great on the counter as well, highly recommended

reviews.reviewTitle: Good after getting rid of the smell
reviews.reviewText: I have had this for about 5 months and I like it. It did have a smell when I got it. I got rid of it by mixing somewhere between 1/2 and 1 cup of baking soda in water (filled to the max line) and let it sit for 2-3 days, boiling it a few times in that period. Afterwards, I rinsed and boiled some fresh water and the smell was gone.

reviews.reviewTitle: Beautiful but cracks after a short time
reviews.reviewText: I love the look and ease of use of this product but I’m currently on my second one because they crack. The first one cracked around the handle. The second is now cracked along the spout. It’s frustrating because I SO want it to work! I actually debating on whether to buy a third. I’m wondering if it’s cracking from the heat and cold of adding water to it? Idk but I’m so disappointed. I’ve owned this one since mid June of this year. It’s now October.
They often drop in price. Bought for myself, sister, mother, and aunt!!! Everyone loves them!

love love this! looks so pretty on the counter, heats the water quickly, and its a great size for a family of four to have hot water for soup, French press coffee, tea, or cocoa :) very pleased with this purchase. as a precaution to afore mentioned rusting on the metal bottom, I empty it and dry the inside with a towel after each use.

All it does it heat water so call me a silly if you must, but I LOVE this thing. Mine has worked well for weeks now and heats in minutes. It does shut off so you must reheat if you don't use the water soon. The silver is lovely and not chipped anywhere. I went out and spent more on tea than I did on the kettle just so I could use it every day.

I am absolutely in LOVE with this tea kettle! It heats quickly and looks absolutely fabulous on my counter! The only thing that I liked about my last kettle that this doesn't have is a window that shows the water level. I have heated it up with only a teensy bit of water in it which I didn't do with the other kettle. Small issue with a great tea kettle.

I am very happy with this kettle. I wanted a pretty kettle and I did not want to spend $200 which is what the gorgeous Italian and German kettles cost. This is all ceramic. I do not care for plastic and would not consider a plastic kettle. It is lovely on the counter. It is heavy and so one needs to be careful with it. It is perfect for our uses...I am not giving it a 5 star as I have only had it for a month or so, so I hope it is excellent quality as well.

reviews.reviewTitle: I love the look of this tea kettle but it is ...
reviews.reviewText: I love the look of this tea kettle but it is heavy. My husband isn't a big fan but he knows I really like it. Our last one broke when I bumped it against our Kitchen aid mixer. The spout broke and I couldn't figure out how to reattach without poisoning our water with glue.

reviews.reviewTitle: Impressed how quickly water is heated
reviews.reviewText: Does a nice job heating your water in a short time. I thought I saw somewhere about coffee and I need a product that makes coffee. I should have re-read description. "or for french press'. I will be making more tea that I do like.

reviews.reviewTitle: Warms water in a jiffy and you can walk away.
reviews.reviewText: This is so cute! Qual Ty is good and it is much larger than I expected. Heats up water in a jiffy. I plan to use it for tea, flu medicine, hot chocolatie, mmm lemon and honey water. It’s so nice not to stand over the stove to warm your water.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great if you value aesthetics over functionality.
reviews.reviewText: This is a very pretty electric tea kettle, but my $30 stainless steel one from Target holds more water and keeps it hotter longer. Stainless steel electric kettles often have a means of showing the water level from the outside of the kettle, and sometimes the temperature as well.

reviews.reviewTitle: Loved it so much I bought 4 more. Really nice for boiling tea water. Fast and pretty.
reviews.reviewText: Love it! We received it as a gift and we use it multiple times a day to boil tea water. We liked it so much we bought 3 of them as gifts for relatives and a 4th to take to our lake house. Really fast and convenient and requires nearly no cleaning. Plus it looks really nice sitting on the kitchen counter.

reviews.reviewTitle: Works great. Get hot water quick and perfect size for ...
reviews.reviewText:
This is so clean and purity on the counter. Works great. Get hot water quick and perfect size for what I need.
One down size is outside get very hot. But I be careful and all good to go. Make sure water is inside so I don't crack them. I use at least two time in the morning and so far so good.

reviews.reviewTitle: Better tan a tea kettle, heats much faster!
reviews.reviewText: Bought this as a requested Christmas gift for one of my daughters. She loves it for making tea, she uses it about 4 times a week!

reviews.reviewTitle: Beautiful kettle! I'm so happy with it!
reviews.reviewText: Love this kettle! It's exactly what I've been searching for. It looks great on the counter, works wonderfully. I did not have a problem with the seal or an odor as others have mentioned. There is a tiny flaw on the ceramic... like a paint smudge but no one notices. Heats water quickly. I would definitely recommend!

reviews.reviewTitle: cute & functional, with a swivel base.
reviews.reviewText: I've had this for a month now & really like it. The reason it doesn't get 5 stars is because it doesn't have a filter option & is on the heavy side. Other than that, it is cute (I got the white/silver one) and works like a charm. I really like that it swivels on the base.

This kettle is great. It heats very quickly and is beatiful on my counter. If there is anything negative to say, it would be that when it's full it's quite heavy. BUT, it's ceramic and that's what I expect. Bought one for my daughter also, and she loves it.

I ordered this for my elderly aunt who was regularly forgetting she had her tea-kettle on the stove...she was excited to receive such a beautiful thing but called today to say it's too heavy for her to lift empty, so how could she pour water from it...she's sorry to have to return it, because of its beauty, but she can't use it.

Very pleased with this electric kettle. I have owned quite a few over the years and, so far, this works as well as any. I was concerned that I might not be able to immediately refill the kettle while it was still hot since it is ceramic. But, based on other customers kind responses to my question I purchased it about 2 months ago -- and using it several times daily -- that has not been a problem.

I have had problems in the past keeping kettles on my kitchen counters as there are no open areas that do not have wall cabinets above them. My previous kettle threw off a great deal of steam and damaged the finish on my wooden cabinet door fronts. I am guessing it is because of the difference in the shape of the spout on this one, but it emits a great deal less steam. That has been a nice bonus feature for me.

Due to my arthritis I was worried about the weight of the unit. If that is a concern for you I found it was only slightly heavier than my previous stainless steel model. This kettle is approximately 6" in diameter and 9'' tall ( including the top handle on the lid but NOT counting the base, which adds about another 1".) Empty, the kettle weighs 3 lbs. 14 oz. Filled with water to the maximum line it weighs 6 lbs. 11 oz. It holds 5.5 cups of water at the maximum level mark. I have not found the weight to be a problem -- the bottom of the unit stays cool and you can easily balance the weight by supporting it from underneath, if necessary.

The lid has a silicone gasket which holds the lid on securely, even when pouring out the last drop. In spite of our hard water, which in the past has deposited unsightly rust stains on some of my previous kettles, I have not had the same problem with this one. I do occasionally clean it out with a little vinegar. I have found it quite easy to keep clean.

I also love the look of it -- I bought the blue Aztec design and it is very pretty with my dinnerware.

Love love my kettle it’s soo pretty
It’s color blue and white make it fun to coordinate with your blue decor it’s a little on the heavy side when water is in it please be careful use two hands if your hands are petite like mine . I will definitely buy another one later in the future if something happens to this one but so far no problems

reviews.reviewTitle: Great product until it started to leak
reviews.reviewText: Great product until it started to leak. After about a year and a half of use has begun to leak out of the bottom, have never dropped the unit or done anything to cause physical damage. Sad it didn’t last longer.

I get many compliments with this sitting on my counter however after 18 months the rubber ring/band that holds the lid on when you pour the hot water ripped and now I need to be careful when I pour or especially when my guest pour as the top is hot and comes loose now when it is tipped forward. Overall I like the look, style and function of this item.

reviews.reviewTitle: Second one, will keep getting them!
reviews.reviewText: This is our second, we had the purple but it started to get worn out after 5 years of use from a HEAVY tea drinker, and we replaced it with the silver, actually like the pattern more, and it is just gorgeous and works great

This product is AMAZING! Very easy to use, gorgeous to look at, affordable and heats water quickly. I purchased it for a tea party. It's a little heavy for smaller kids, because it's a great quality ceramic piece. I didn't have the issue other reviewers reported with the bad smell/tatse. It did however smell "new." If you've been unsure about this purchase, wait no longer. I'm sure you'll love it.
This is beautiful, and healthier for you than using a plastic kettle. It's almost too pretty. LOL But it works excellently and looks nice on the counter, too.

This tea kettle is beautiful & it works wonderfully. I do make sure that it is completely empty after I use it and I let it air dry completely before putting the top back on. I've only had it two weeks but so far I love it!

Just got this today and it is beautiful just like the pictures! It's a really nice size and the print is great, I debated between a few of them because they are all so cute. There was a tiny chip on the pour spout but nothing anyone would notice if they weren't looking, I thinks it's worth the money and super cute will see if it holds up.
Love my ceramic electric kettle. I bought this for our hot chocolate bar. Heats up water quickly. So far we love it and haven’t had any issues.

I've never owned an electric kettle but this has really changed my tea experience. It's so fast and convenient. I'm glad I got rid of my stovetop kettle. I selected this electric kettle because I wanted to reduce plastic exposure. There is some plastic inside and it can give off a weird odor as some have mentioned. In general, I think it's better than other models.
Its a very pretty kettle but it leaks horribly! I cannot leave water sitting in it for a few hours without coming back to a puddle on my kitchen counter. Very disappointing.

What I like: It is FAST!! It looks beautiful!
I would have given it five stars, but I wish the water stayed hot longer. when I go back for my second cup I have to reheat, but then again, it is SUPER FAST, so it's not a big deal. But I like it better than dealing with a teapot on the stove. I like that it shuts itself off.
I wish that it would "ding" or something when it turns off, though.

Bought this last September and today it just stopped working. We don't even use it every day, maybe 4-5 times a week max? Yes it's pretty, but the quality is non-existent, so this was a total waste of money. Better to spend more money and invest in a Zojirushi hot water dispenser (which is what I'll be doing now), I had one that lasted 7+ years.

Love it and very pretty on my kitchen counter.
I love it..is a little heavy, and first i ordered it came with the led a litle loose, so i ordered anothere kne..is perfevt, i both one more for my friend asa gift...
So beautiful and stylish. I was afraid it would be really delicate and break but I've (lightly) banged the lid and the kettle against things by accident several times and no cracks yet.

reviews.reviewTitle: My New Bella Kettle is Beautiful
reviews.reviewText: I am loving my new tea kettle from Bella. The kettle is larger than I expected which is a "good" thing. The design is quite to my liking and is elegant yet a bit understated. It came wrapped tightly with all the pieces included and working perfectly. The min/max lines inside the kettle make it easy to ensure that you have enough water at all times. It makes a wonderful addition to my currently kitchen decor. I cannot say enough good things about my new Bella Electric Ceramic Tea Kettle and I use it everyday.

lovely and functional. time will tell about quality.

Update:
RIP Bella Kettle. 11/2017- 05/2018. I just woke up with morning to find that the kettle just would not work.

reviews.reviewTitle: Looks good, functions great, almost no plstic
reviews.reviewText:
I love this thing. Gets a couple of quarts of water boiling in a few minutes. It is much faster than my stove can even heat up. It is about as quick and draws the same power (measured with a Kill-A-Watt) as the induction cooktop I just picked up. I occasionally preboil water for cooking to reduce heatup times when using my ceramic cooktop stove since it takes so long to heat up.

There is a silicone or flexible plastic seal that keeps the lid secured while pouring as well as seals the heat in to speed up boiling. There is another seal that plugs the hole in the bottom of the lid. There is also a small plastic cap up the stainless riser tube that I assume houses the pyrometer that the kettle uses to measure water temperature for shutoff. I have not disassembled the kettle yet to determine what the tube is used for and if it will be okay to run it without the cap, but I assume it needs it to prevent moisture from dripping diwn the tube. It may also be a vent for trapped steam should there be a small seep of moisture into the base of the kettle where the electronics and heating element are.

Ideally this would have no plastic, but the amount of plastic in the kettle is minimal enough to not be overly concerning.
If the stainless tube is just for a pyrometer, I would prefer to see the tube sealed off. The lid seals can be removed, but caution will be needed when pouring to prevent burning one's hand.

I LOVE this kettle. I got this to replace a plastic kettle I had gotten from Aldis. I prefer this in both aesthetic and function. This looks so much better sitting out on the counter than most kettles. I find it heats up quickly and shuts off when it has boiled.

reviews.reviewTitle: Y'ALL it's beautiful & I love it

Gorgeous design and quality.
I bought 2 more as gifts.
Love this! Perfect for 1 person. I use it in my white dressing room. It’s not small but will serve 2 cups of tea at a time. Heats fast & reliable

Someone else bought this kettle a few years ago and the cord was longer. The kettles are beautiful and work superbly. If the cord had been longer, I would have given it a 5 and a glowing review.

Beautiful pot. Boils water REALLY hot. Not exactly as quick as I thought it would be ...but maybe I'm impatient. You be the judge: I filled the water level to the max line inside of the pot (which is actually about 3/4 up the pot) and it took (drumroll)..... 6 minutes and 6 seconds to boil from the second I flipped the switch until the blue light switch at the base of the pot turned off signalling that the water was ready. In all honesty, it sounds like the water boils around 4+ minutes but I'm afraid to mess up the cycle and remove the pot midway so I let it finish the cycle. I was able to reheat my coffee cup in 45 seconds in the microwave while waiting on this experiment and I'd say my traditional whistle kettle would probably heat water in a similar 5-10 minute frame. BUT... this is a pretty kettle with the silver trim and long neck spout, and it holds a decent amount of water. So I conclude that I like the convenience of heating the water and bringing it directly to the table in a prettier pot than my functional-looking round belly red metal tea kettle. In other words, it is function and serving elegance in one.

Worked great right out of the box (after washing), replacing an older Russell Hobbs stainless kettle that was a gift. It has a smaller footprint and is much more attractive on the countertop, heats just a little faster and much more quietly, and keeps water hot for longer. The handle is on the side instead of on top so it's also easier to refill than the Russell Hobbs was, with much lower risk of steam burns. The only real drawback is that it is heavy, especially when filled. If you have children who might be using it, or if you have small hands, arthritis, or wrist problems, this is not the kettle for you. Another caveat: probably because we are in Alaska, we were charged shipping on checkout even though the page claimed free shipping.
