So beautiful !

reviews.reviewTitle: Great tea pot heats p quick
reviews.reviewText: I bought this due to going through a military move and my old tea pot got broken. I am very pleased with this one. It heats up the water very fast and it is very hot. I keep it out on my counter because it is nice to look at also. I love the colors. this is a great tea pot and I would recommend it to everyone. I also use the teapot to heat water up to make sweet tea in a pinch.
We love our Bella.
Great product!
I like the color. Haven't used it yet.
Lovely product good to look at
Looks beautiful
Beautiful!!
A+

Arrived with a chip in the spout of the kettle.
So bummed!
Beautiful and perfect for tea parties
love this! boils water fast and it is not plastic. pretty too

It's a nice kettle but it does have plastic inside. Also, the kettle that I got was dirty on the outside and the bottom, but nothing major.
It does emanate a plastic odour after boiling water.
Surprisingly, the handle never heats up and you can pour the water without the air of a mitt.
It arrived the day after ordering it, on a Sunday morning. We woke up and the package was outside our door. How nice.

I like this thing. It's bigger than I was imagining. Heats water very fast - don't walk away! The lid came with a gasket thingy which smelled like some kind of chemical toxin no matter how many times I washed it. I took that part off and threw it away. I don't think I need it. Just have to be sure to hold the lid whilst pouring, and never leave it unattended while it's on, which is common sense anyway..
very heavy, boil slow.... but pretty looking!
Inside smells like glue...strong chemical smell...this is not where I want to boil my water. Returning it
I love this kettle very stylish and matches the decor in my kitchen.
Great kettle, attractive design and well constructed.
Beautiful kettle, so elegant...but very heavy
I absolutely love it. Very pretty, well made, works great!

reviews.reviewTitle: Doesn't keep the tea hot! Gets cold fast
reviews.reviewText: It doesn't keep the tea hot! It gets cold way too fast. And there is no way to measure the amount of water you put in so you can properly measure the tea. You have to guess or use a measuring cup. It's adorable and heats quickly and is quiet. I would return it if it hadn't been too long already. Very disappointing :(
Don't waste your money! Impossible to assemble, cheap parts. Terrible product!!

reviews.reviewTitle: Big disappointment. If I could give it zero stars
reviews.reviewText: This did not work. The on/off switch would not turn on. Big disappointment. If I could give it zero stars, I would.

I bought this kettle for my elderly parents and it is too heavy for my mother to lift. She also doesn't like the fact that it is not possible to see the water level and that it is rather difficult to close the lid. It has to be pressed firmly and then twisted. When one pours the water, lid cannot be touched because it is hot. My father had no difficulty but it is used by all family members and for those with young children it might be a hazard. It is made in China.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great to have settings, works very well...
reviews.reviewText:
We've had excellent luck with this kettle. Our main reason for using this is the french press coffee we drink in the morning. It is SO much easier than a traditional stovetop kettle. This one has a function that allows you to hold the temperature while you go about your other business. It doesn't have a kettle whistle to drive you bonkers in the early AM. The feature brings it to the desired temperature and holds it there until you are ready for it. It works very well.

This operates with the touch of a button. As mentioned before, we are french press coffee drinkers and the setting on the kettle brings it to the perfect temperature to use for that (just below full boil). There are settings for various teas, coffees, and cooking implements. All work well. There is also just a choice to go for it!

The look of this is very nice. It looks beautiful on the countertop. The kettle is a heavy ceramic (glass maybe) and the base is small, which helps it to fit in well on the countertop. It is a bit heavy, so if you have a family member that may struggle with arthritis or struggles that are similar, it may not work. I love the design and with many options, you will find something that works for your kitchen.

I live this a lot. The reason for the 4 stars is cleaning. It is browning a little on the inside, and while I can clean it out it is a bit of a pain.

Love the look and the function of this!

reviews.reviewTitle: Be ready to deal with horrible customer service after a year
reviews.reviewText: As a grad school student, this teapot was a splurge. I loved it for the year it worked... but now it drips (and sometimes pours) out of the bottom. I have emailed the company four times and they have not so much as gotten back to me. I can’t afford to buy another and I LOVE my tea, so this is a loss. I should not have to buy one every year!!

This heats up water SO fast! Seriously by the time I get my coffee mug down, put a tea bag in it, the water is boiling. It's so quick and saves so much time. I have also used it a few times to help me boil water faster for cooking, like for making pasta. I will throw the water in here, get my pan and noodles out, and it's nearly almost already boiling. It doesn't take up too much counter space and has been a great convenience item for making soups, oatmeal, and french press coffee as well.
The copper finish is really pretty and elegant and the LED light is nice. I also love that the lid seals with a button seal (so makes it heat faster than the ceramic removable lids).

This review is for the Chrome Copper finish.
This is a smart and interesting design.
I found is easy to hold, open and turn on. The time to boil is at par with other kettles I had.

The most interesting thing about it is the illumination.
When the light is off it's a little hard to tell how much water is inside - but when you turn it on the bottom light strips illuminates exactly a sliver of light where the water touches the glass (see video) this looks very cool.

Nice filter in the nozzle.

Buy it if you dig the color and the illumination style.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great experiences with all five kettles we have purchased
reviews.reviewText: I am confused why there are so many negative reviews for this tea kettle. I am wondering if perhaps the quality has gone down, as we purchased five of these kettles... all purchased about four years ago... and they are all used frequently and still going strong. One is at my mother's home (blue/white), one at my son's home (teal/white), one at our home (silver/white), one at my husband's office (gray/white), and one given as a gift to his secretary (teal/white). We liked that they were available in a variety of designs to suit any decor, and the ceramic construction is nice enough to be left out on the counter. As we are all frequent tea drinkers, these pots are generally used 3-5 times minimum each day, and all are still functioning as well as the day they were purchased. The lids sit well, the seals are tight, there are no leaks, and the heating elements work well. Given the number of recent negative reviews, I cannot help but wonder if something changed in the production process at Bella... but the price is still the same as what we paid. Based on our experience with the five we purchased, I highly recommend this tea kettle.

I'm a fan generally of electric kettles--they boil water way faster than kettles on my stove, and given all the hummingbird nectar I cook up every day, that's a real plus. I've been using a mundane but functional Hamilton Beach stainless steel kettle for several years, and I love it, but it's starting to show its age, and its only a matter of time before it needs replacing.

I'm not interested in plastic kettles, not wanting whatever chemicals can leach from the plastic into the water. But this one caught my eye because it's glass, and it's really, really attractive.

From a functional POV, it boils water effectively, though not quite as fast as my Hamilton Beach kettle--but certainly acceptably. I haven't had the problem with dripping that other reviewers have mentioned, apart from a drop or two at the spout--certainly nothing to get upset over. And it doesn't seem especially heavy to me. The blue LEDs around the base are a nice, albeit unnecessary, touch, and I like that the gauge window on the side is large enough for you to tell when it's boiling, not just the water level. But that gauge window is the reason I deducted a star--it's on the wrong side for me to watch while I'm filling it because I'm right handed, and there's only one way I can orient the kettle while I'm filling it. In order to see the level, I have to stop pouring and turn it around, then turn it back around to continue filling it. (I use filtered water, so don't fill from the tap, but the issue would be the same regardless.) Why they didn't put a gauge window on both sides, as Procter-Silex did with one my friend has, I don't know. But as it's configured, it really only works to rely on the gauge window while you're filling the kettle if you're left handed.

Apart from that, it's a great kettle, and I'll continue to use it.

Four solid stars.

reviews.reviewTitle: UPDATE: Lid sticks and breaks ... Beautiful and functional!
reviews.reviewText:
Update 10/19: (1/5 stars)

The lid sticks tightly and when you pull can suddenly pop off. Since it breaks easily, we were careful but eventually one time it popped off and broke on our tile floor since it is ceramic. Unfortunately, the manufacturer cannot provide replacement parts so now the kettle is useless. They need a better gasket and should make parts available!

Original review: (4/5 stars)

I do love it! I got this despite some negative reviews because it's a pretty ceramic kettle with various temperature options. I would love it more if it was the size of a large teapot. Instead it's a huge 7.5 cup capacity which is a bit heavy. I never boil that much hot water. I only ever boil 2 cups/16 oz. which is the minimum it can boil. 5 cup capacity would be plenty.

Blue lights show the settings and it beeps when hot. It has a "keep warm" button if you want it to hold that temperature - then it will turn off after two hours. (Or if all the water boils off, which I tested and it does work!)

The plastic ring keeps the lid from falling off. The controls work and there are no leaks. Perhaps it will crack if bumped. Just don't put in cold water while its hot - wait till it cools.

reviews.reviewTitle: This is not the same pitcher as the one that got abismal reviews on this same page.
reviews.reviewText:
I feel sorry that the manufacturer has combined the product I received on the same product page with the one that got so many complaints for design and construction defects. I got a beautiful, 5-star pitcher with none of the problems described!

First, it *does* have a window to allow you to see how much water is in it, and you can watch it boil. Second, it boils quickly - even as you watch (dispelling the old wive's tail about the watched pot, etc.). Third, the top pops up easily with a push button release. It pours gently, and a little slowly. Very easy to control and get just the right amount. The finish on the chrome is a gorgeous copper color that looks phenomenal on our granite counter with warm tones.

I LOVE that is has 360-degree lateral spin on the base. I have 2 other electric kettles, and the fact that it has to nest super precisely to be correctly on the base is the one thing I hate about them - but I had no idea someone had come up with a fix for it! If you haven't experienced the other kind (if this pitcher is your only foray into electric kettles) please know that this is an AWESOME feature.

It warms quickly, and has a wide-open interior that's super easy to clean. Here is another way in which it is superior to my other pitchers: they have an exposed element right inside, and it accumulates mineral deposits. Sure, you can clean them with white vinegar, but with this unit, just wiping it out every few times will keep deposits from accumulating - plus, there's nothing in the way of it getting cleaned out completely, with no weird angles or cracks to deal with.

I LOVE THIS PITCHER. It's a vast improvement over the 3 other pitchers we own, and clearly not the same thing as the beleaguered ones that have gotten such poor reviews on this page. Purchase the Chrome Copper unit with confidence. You'll love it!!

First, I want to note that a variety of this company's kettles are merged here, which really shouldn't happen. They're very different kettles, so pay attention to the reviews specific to the one you're interested in. My review is for the Copper Chrome kettle.

The kettle itself is stylish and looks good on a counter or table for serving.

The glass on the side makes it easy to see your water level.

Water heats quickly, though not quite as quickly as my old kettle. Still, it's faster than putting a regular kettle on a burner.

Unfortunately, this kettle does not have a temperature setting. That's probably not an issue for people who are using this for black tea, hot chocolate, etc. But for people like me, who drink a variety of tea types, temperature control is important. (Each type of tea is best made with a specific water temperature.) Consequently, I tend to use my older kettle more often than I use this one.

reviews.reviewTitle: Very nice kettle, a little heavy
reviews.reviewText:
Edit:

Reduced this to four stars. I've switched back to the Ovente kettle. It's lighter and the water indicator is on the front which makes it easier to fill. The Bella kettle has great build quality, so it's a higher quality kettle. But better usability won out over overall quality.

Original review:

I like this a lot. I have a couple of Ovente kettles which are nice enough but rather cheaply made. This Bella kettle is much higher quality. It's ceramic vs metal and the top seals so no water comes out of it. This actually makes the top a little difficult to remove. For someone that's older this might be a problem. The kettle itself is also much heavier than the Ovente as the ceramic material adds a lot of weight. Not a problem for me, but if I was looking for a kettle for my 80 year old mom, I'd think twice about it. But again, it's much higher quality than the Ovente.

Since I drink a lot of green tea I need a kettle with temperature controls. This has easy, intuitive controls on the base.

Overall an excellent, multi-temperature kettle which has become my new go-to kettle.

I really like the look of this kettle. The color of the outside material is really attractive. Involves water OK, just make sure to fill it to at least the minimum line (although I found it does still boil if about 1/2" below that line). It has a neat glowing blue light while it boils. It shuts itself off after the water has reached boiling point. Note, however, it does not have a keep warm feature, although if you need more hot water soon after the first pour it'll heat it up soon enough.

The one issue I have with this item is that the outside of the kettle gets hot to the touch. After a couple of uses at a time, you will find that the handle, around the top third where your thumb would be, also gets quite warm. If you are careful about this it should not be a problem, but if there are children are around you should be aware of this. Actually, if there is anyone else around you should make them aware that you have just used it to boil water and therefore it may be hot. UPDATE: I've found that other models/brands also get hot on the outside, e.g. Black and Decker, Hamilton Beach, etc. So it seems normal for this to happen, just be aware of it.

It makes it easy to boil water because of its auto shut off feature, which is easier than putting a tea pot on the stove, which you will have to shut off yourself. It also looks great in your counter. But watch out for those hot surfaces.

It’s worth noting that if you pay attention to the reviews on this page, it appears that two different kettles have been merged into one collection of reviews. Those two kettles are very different and not comparable. My review is specifically for the “BELLA (14753) 1.7 Liter Electric Illuminated Glass Kettle with Automatic Shut Off & Detatchable Swivel Base, Full Chrome Copper Glass Finish“ .

For me, this has been a really good kettle. Looks great, boils water relatively quickly, and doesn’t leak at all. It’s not the fastest to boil I’ve owned, but its not been an issue. I can easily see the water level from outside the pot as it’s entirely a see through glass body that has just been tinted, but you can still see the water level. Only complaint is this kettle doesn’t have a variety of specific temperature settings, its just a full boil. It’s not so imperative to me, but may be important to others, so just wanted to point that out. Overall, this kettle has performed will for me over the last several months.

reviews.reviewTitle: Pretty, works well and so convenient
reviews.reviewText:
I love this BELLA (14746) 1.5 Liter Electric Ceramic Tea Kettle (in Black Floral). I selected this item because my electric kettle was on its last legs and ready to be recycled as a planter. I like electric kettles so when I saw this product, it looked like it would improve on my current one and it did.

The black and white floral graphic is pretty. It is bigger (and heavier) than I thought it would be but I'm okay with that. It was easy to set up and use. The one grumble that I have with my current pot is that the wide spout would spill outside of where I was pouring, no matter how careful I was. The spout on this tea kettle is longer and narrower so it is accurate when it is poured. The hardest part of cleaning is that it is heavier than expected but otherwise, it is straightforward to clean. Lastly, it is so convenient to have. I drink at least 3 cups of tea through the day and not always the same kind. In the morning, I can pour the hot water into my glass kettle to make my English breakfast tea. In the afternoon (or evening), I can pour directly into my cup for hibiscus, jasmine or my favorite peppermint green tea. I'm just really happy with it and I can now retire my old electric kettle.

I am somewhat split on this kettle, but mostly enjoy it. The main downside for me is the spout design, which makes it difficult to pour without some water dripping. I do not have this issue with my other kettles. However, I have not had the leaking issue that some others have reported. In terms of speed, the kettle takes 9 minutes to come to a rolling boil when filled in the 1.8 L version. This is a bit longer than my other kettles, but it also holds heat longer because of the ceramic, so it is a draw.

In terms of style, this kettle is by far the most beautiful one I have seen, including plastic and metal. The controls are touch and very straightforward. Instead of tapping the power button to scroll through temperatures, you just touch the temperature you want. Yes, it is heavy, which is a plus for me.

If you want a kettle that looks more at home in a country kitchen, this is a decent choice. The dripping is a little annoying, but I still enjoy it.

I bought this for about $50 from Target. I have had three stainless steel kettles in the last ten years. The last two were complete junk, and the last one even rusted. I decided not to trust the quality of steel kettles anymore and didn't want clear glass either. I liked the traditional shape of this one, but I'm not crazy about the painted design (I did not downgrade for the design, however).

All-in-all, it's ok. It is better than my last two stainless kettles - but the fill line is about halfway up the pot and doesn't hold the amount of water in one boil that I need. I am also not convinced that the rubber seal on the lid is going to last as long as the rest of it.

If you've ever had ceramic sugar bowls or canisters it will develop that same cruddy feeling on the outside of it that will require regular washing instead of Clorox wiping & polishing which you can do with stainless appliances. The lid is not attached to the pot and can be completely immersed for washing. To wash the pot itself, wash it upside-down and gently spray-rinse it so no water runs into the electrical components on the bottom.

Edited December 12, 2014 - I ended up returning this one because the aforementioned issues did not justify the price I paid for it. Surprisingly enough, I bought the (cheaper) Hamilton Beach red stainless steel kettle because it was the only one under $50 that I liked. It has held up nicely for about eight months. It's beautiful too and the red color is a nice pop for my mostly white and stainless kitchen.

Edited October 5, 2015 - I am still using the red stainless Hamilton Beach kettle. It is easy to clean, has not rusted, hasn't leaked. It does take slightly too long to turn off after boiling, but given that it hasn't been a total rip-off or piece of junk like my last few kettles, I'm happy with it.

Confession: at first I didn't like this kettle.
It was too complicated for my eighty-year-old mother. She just wants to boil water. But after thinking about it, I realized that some people might have different values. For instance, the control panel is flat and so it makes it easy to clean.

Second, once I opened up the manual, I could see that different teas require different temperatures. I had no idea about that. So if you are a tea Aficionado, you probably would love such a kettle. I never knew that people were so finicky about the temperature of the water for their tea. Obviously, there is a whole subculture for tea nuts.

If you're part of that culture, then you would love this kettle. If you just want to boil water each and every time, you can do that with this, but you might want to consider ones that have a more simple interface. They just have a simple switch and don't give you all these options.

Update: i downgraded my review. I loved this kettle so much I gave away my old one. Sadly it died in May. I started using it in February. No response from the company after two weeks so I’ve given up on getting any kind of CS and got a different brand. This was an unacceptable lifespan for a kettle like this. Super disappointing.

Original review 5/5 stars: So far I love this (will update if that changes).

My old kettle had just on and off and no warming feature. So for me this is a major step up. It has multiple temperature settings (lists both the temp + what it’s ideal for). Great for those who drink many types of teas but who don’t have the temps memorized (me). Easy to use - fill, choose temp setting, when it’s done hit the keep warm setting if you won’t need the water for awhile.

It something happened to it, I’d probably buy another and will donate my old kettle because this is so much nicer.

I LOVE this tea kettle! I was expecting something like the plastic water kettles that I've used during my travels in Europe and Asia (where they are much more popular) but was pleasantly surprised to open up this package and find a heavy, ceramic kettle! I MUCH prefer to be using a ceramic kettle (there is a metal plate in the bottom) than drinking boiling water made in a plastic container. Even the cap is ceramic, but there is a silicone ring around the bottom, to hold the cap tightly in place. The design is very pretty, looks like a marbled counter. And I was surprised there were no buttons on the hot plate. It's a touch surface glass (like with a smartphone). You touch the temperature you want the water to heat to, and it lights up. So simple to use. I would highly recommend and would definitely gift this item over and over for friends for housewarming gifts.

This kettle is fantastic, it looks great in our kitchen, and boils water more rapidly and quietly than our previous electric kettle. Access to the fill top is easy, it holds plenty of water to make tea or fill our french press, and the temperature selection options help ensure that the water is the right temperature for the right application so you don't wind up with burnt tasting green tea, or weak coffee. I still can't wrap my head around how much quieter and faster it is than our old electric kettle, which wasn't all that old. If you're looking for an upgrade, look no further!

Take note: The kettle is made of ceramic and is already kind of heavy. When it's full, people with frail wrists or carpal tunnel syndrome should take care when lifting off the base as it can be quite heavy. As with other electric kettles, cleaning can also be a bit trickly.

This kettle looks awesome, and works pretty well for what I use it for which is my nightly tea. I probably use it once or twice a day. It heats the water very quickly but for some reason my doesn’t have an automatic off switch which I kind of though was a standard feature on any electric kettle. The other downside is that the Max level in the kettle is WAY lower than that is labeled. When I filled it to the max line it splattered and boiled over big time. The spout is great and pours nicely without any leaks. You can use it with loose leaf tea in it but I haven’t tried it yet. The screen is just little holes poked through the ceramic...some smaller bits of tea could wiggle through. But overall I love the way this kettle works and after a little trial and error it has turned out to be a great addition to my kitchen.

I love tea and I especially love tea kettles. I have a beautiful copper stovetop kettle but for some time had been contemplating picking up an electric kettle as well to keep upstairs when I want a cup of tea but don't want to make a whole ceremony of it.

First off, this kettle is beautiful. It has a black floral pattern but somehow still manages to look modern and elegant. The blue indicator light though is weird looking and doesn't seem to fit in with aesthetic.

Easy to use, has an auto shut off, and boils water fast. Not much more I could ask for.

reviews.reviewTitle: Hot water at the temperature you want
reviews.reviewText:
This is a beautiful pot that provides hot water at several preset temperatures so that you can get it just right for the kind of tea you are making. So if you want your green tea or oolong made from exactly the right temperature of water, this is the pot for you. It heats quickly. Pours neatly. Holds the temperature. Its easy to use. Shuts off so it doesn't cook dry.

Things you need to take into consideration: The pot is heavy when full. The lid, which has a nice seal to it, is also hard to get off if your hands are arthritic. You can only put water in it. So it's not an all purpose sort of pot for heating liquids to preset temperatures. I'm not going to subtract stars for any of this because the pot is exactly what it is meant to be.
The cord is SO SHORT. You'll need a small extension cord if your outlets are anything but flush with your countertops. The hot plate won't sit flat on my counter while plugged in.

reviews.reviewTitle: Boil water fast and looks nice.
reviews.reviewText:
I picked this kettle after reading about the issue that others have with the lids. The lid on this kettle is operated with a push button, easily open when filling it with water to boil. Just be careful, when it is hot some droplet of water could get to your hand!

I like the look of copper, it is "copper chrome" so it is not real copper that could cost many times more. It boils water really fast, a full kettle took under 6 minutes. I have not tries, but there other safety measures built-in such as boil-dry prevention. The kettle shut itself off if no water remained.

The only thing this kettle needs is if tit can heat up water to different temperatures. As it is, it can only boil water, which it can do well for kettle in its price range.

reviews.reviewTitle: No temperature control--it's on or it's off
reviews.reviewText:
This tea kettle is awesome! It boils your water in NO time (quicker than the Hamilton Beach). It looks great on the counter, too.

The only thing I do not like is that it doesn't have temperature control. It's either on or off. I did not mark it down, because that's not a make-or-break for me, but if you're looking for something that leaves your water a particular temperature, this may not be for you.

It cleans easily, stores easily...

One thing--it says that you should not put it directly on the countertop. I put a trivet beneath, but that was a little off-putting for me. I felt like they may have skipped a step in construction, there.

reviews.reviewTitle: Boils large mount of water very quickly. Very large kettle.
reviews.reviewText:
If you are looking for a kettle that can boil large amount of water quickly, look no further.

This kettle is made of high quality (plastic) construction. The water left no residue of foul chemical smell.

It is also easy to use (just press on one button to boil).

My only gripe is that the lid doesn't open at least 90 degrees as it does make it somewhat difficult to pour water directly using my reverse osmosis filter.

Pros:
1)Boils large amount of water very quickly. Even 1.5 liter of water can be boiled in under 8 minutes (as long as the water was not ice cold).
2)High quality construction.

Cons:
1)I wish the lid opens to a wider angle. But this is not a biggie.

reviews.reviewTitle: I really like this tea kettle.
reviews.reviewText: BELLA 1.5 Liter Electric Ceramic Tea Kettle with Boil Dry Protection & Detachable Swivel Base is a lovely addition to my kitchen. It heats water quickly and keeps it warm for quite awhile. The pretty white marble look on the exterior is compatible with any kitchen decor and the detachable base is a nice touch to allow ease of cleaning. The BELLA shuts itself off to avoid boiling the kettle dry or starting a fire. I would recommend this kettle to anyone who is a fan of teas.

This electric kettle's copper finish is absolutely beautiful. It heats water quickly. I'm able to heat enough water for one cup of tea, enough for a pot of tea when friends are stopping by, or enough to fill a 2 qt. pitcher half full so I can seep tea bags for iced tea. I put 5 tea bags in a 2 qt. pitcher, fill it half way with hot water, let it seep a while as I do other things, later I come back and fill the rest of the pitcher with plain water then just put in the refrigerator to get cold. That way I can enjoy cold tea every day, all year long without a lot of fuss.

There's something about having an electric copper kettle in the kitchen that adds warmth and says "Welcome home."

reviews.reviewTitle: Like having tea with the Queen of England
reviews.reviewText: I just love this electric kettle. Its design (clear lines, old-fashioned printing that makes me think of having tea with the queen), its materials (thick ceramic that feels great in your hand and keeps the warmth way longer than plastic or metal) and its simplicity -- who needs a thousand temperature options in their kettle for making tea? Not me. I just want to pour the water in the kettle, hit a button and get the water to boil quickly, which this kettle does beautifully. My only criticism is that the lid is currently too tight (especially when the water is hot, then it must expand a bit cause it's HARD to take off), but I believe that it will give up a bit with use.

This attractive kettle heats water to boiling effortlessly. I bought it for my mother, attracted by its auto-off switch seemed a good safety feature for someone with memory issues. She loves it, but had I realized how heavy it is, I would have chosen differently. Because she finds it attractive, she did not want me to exchange it. To fill it, she slides it across the kitchen counter and uses the sink sprayer hose. I hope someone is actually picking it up and cleaning it between my visits out west!

I recommend it, but only for someone who has the strength to lift and wash it.

reviews.reviewTitle: Good Looking Copper Water Boiler; Works Well
reviews.reviewText:
This is a water boiler that has a water level on the side and a plastic lid.

The outer shell has a copper-metallic look that is more on the matte side. You fill this up with water, and turn it on. Takes about 3-5 minutes to boil, which the 'lever' automatically pops up to let you know its done.

Overall, the quality is nice however opening the lid is a bit of a nuisance, as it sticks sometimes. With this, sometimes it can 'throw up' water if you open it after it boiled, which causes a very hot surprises.

Other than that, it works as it should and is good quality.

I have had one of these kettles for a three years now, alas it broke this morning. A contractor cracked it when doing work on my house. With regards to some of the negative comments about being splashed with hot water when trying to open it, I'm not sure why you would want to remove the lid when the appliance is full and hot. Wouldn't you just pour your water from the spout?

I liked the heavy ceramic body, it was much easier to keep clean then a stainless one I used to own and while the lid can be difficult to remove at times i do not have to worry about it coming loose and getting burned when i am pouring water out of it. The size is just right to fill my French Press when I make coffee in the morning.

I bought the Blue Aztec one from Target OVER two years ago. It is still going strong and looks like brand new! I use it anywhere from 3-7 times per week to boil water for tea, and it has never let me down. It is ever so slightly wobbly when it's on the base, but that doesn't bother me and doesn't affect it's performance. It's easy to wipe down the exterior, and I've never had to clean the interior. Also, every visitor to my house has commented on how nice it looks! It's my favorite tea kettle I've ever owned. And I have owned a lot of electric tea kettles over the years. When it's full of water, it can be heavy, so keep that in mind if you have any hand/wrist problems.
100% recommend and if this one ever breaks, I will definitely be buying the exact same kettle again.

I like this kettle a lot--it's more like an old fashioned tea kettle or coffee pot in shape, and it's porcelain, which is traditional and looks pretty nice sitting on the counter, where our electric kettle lives since we use it every day. This one heats up water as quickly as my other electric kettle which is metal, plus this one has a smaller footprint. It's much more efficient than boiling water on the stove top. This pretty electric kettle might be a good transitional one for someone who isn't so sure about electric kettles.

reviews.reviewTitle: Perfect for a college dorm or home
reviews.reviewText:
When we sent my son to college, we sent him with a mini Keurig. He mostly used it for hot water so we decided that we would let him try a electric kettle. He is really happy with this. There are a few things that he really likes.

- It's smaller than a Keurig
- It's easy to use
- It's easy to clean

I highly recommend this product in lieu of a Keurig for college students or just anyone in general that would like to heat water is something other than a kettle or microwave.

I bought it at target for $34US. It weighs 7# when full of water. I wanted to give it 3 stars but it is so beautiful in my kitchen. It heats the water to boiling a bit slower than my last kettle but that is probably due to the shape and smaller heating element at the bottom.

Well, when it is full and hot u can only grab the handle and support the bottom. Don't touch the spout. Make sure the lid is secure, it sometimes pops out when pouring. There is a stretchy clear rubber running around the lid to keep it in place, this some times comes loose.

It has been three months and it heats the water to boiling at least twice a day.

I love that this is attractive as well as functional.
It heats the water for my cup of tea very quickly. I also use it for my instant oatmeal and instant soup.
Runs a close race with replacing my microwave.
Easy to clean.
I also like the boil dry protection. There's a pretty blue light on the side of the teapot that lets you know when you water is hot and ready to go.
Recommended

reviews.reviewTitle: Heats a little slower than other kettles.
reviews.reviewText:
Update: The switch on the kettle broke after only a few uses.

This kettle heats a little slower than the previous kettle we tested. It takes longer to heat the water and it sometimes leaves an odd taste. I make no changes in how I do things and the water will sometimes have an odd taste.

I would not buy this kettle again, I prefer the other brand that I had before.

reviews.reviewTitle: Ok terrible joke but so true
reviews.reviewText: What can I say about this tea kettle except that it was a hot buy!? Ok terrible joke but so true. This is a beautiful piece that I have proudly displayed on my counter top. I get compliments on how pretty it is all the time. Heats water to a boil in just about a minute with just the flick of the little light up blue switch. Best part is my tea sloth has finally found someone it can rely on to help make my morning tea. Thank you Bella for creating a tea pot that is reliable, beautiful, and that does a great job at heating up water. Would love to sre these beauties come with an option thaat allows me to heat water to different temperatures. Until then cheers!

reviews.reviewTitle: are you stupid? How much water did you put in it
reviews.reviewText: I always read the lower rated reviews on a product and I couldn't believe it. People giving it 1-2 stars because it takes 5-7 minutes to boil water? Have you ever boiled water in a pot? People complaining that you can't see the water level in the kettle? I mean, are you stupid? How much water did you put in it? I regularly fill this thing just below the fill line, start it, and it's done in less than 10 minutes, I usually just sit on the couch for a few minutes and I hear it "click" that it's done. It's fantastic. I've had mine for maybe 2 years of regular use and it still works perfect. Shame that people complain about such trivial stuff.

I have considered myself a die-hard coffee fanatic for several years now, never touching tea or having any interest in it. Funnily enough, watching English YouTube stars rave about how much they love tea made me curious to try it. I wanted a stylish but high quality electric kettle that would look good in my apartment, so I purchased the Bella in the Aztec pattern. I LOVE it!! I am still new to the art of tea brewing, but this kettle makes me excited to keep trying! It's so cute and everyone loves it. It's all ceramic so it's safer than using a metal or plastic kettle or God forbid - a microwave, and it heats up very fast. As others have said, it can be heavy if you have problems with your hands, but I think for most able-bodied people it won't be too heavy at all. I'm currently eagerly awaiting the work day because I picked up some new teas to try out with this handy kettle! You won't regret buying this whether you're a novice tea drinker like me, or a master!

reviews.reviewTitle: It is really beautiful and a great piece to have on the countertop
reviews.reviewText: My husband bought this kettle for me, after seeing me eye it for months. It is really beautiful and a great piece to have on the countertop. However, the metal heating plate inside started to discolor almost immediately and the lid gets very hot to touch when it's heated (this is a problem if you need to refill the kettle right away after having boiled some water in it). Even with these faults, I still like it. But, for the price, I don't think it should have these kinks, particularly the discolored metal heating plate.

This is my first kettle and I now understand why the rest of the world uses them! This BELLA is beautiful, it works so fast, and it gets the job done. I'm finding any reason to use it. I can't believe I used to boil water on the stove. The illumination is useful to know if it's on or not. If you like the color copper you will adore this.

This electric kettle is a winner. It's beautiful, functional and has a great price. I love the finish and the lights that illuminate allowing you to see the level.

I've probably used it 15 times and it worked flawlessly each and every time. I like the filter assembly in the lid and the spout pours evenly.

Great buy!

We put this kettle on our wedding registry, thinking that it would look good in our kitchen. However it is not really what we were hoping for. First this kettle is massive. It is also extremely heavy, so much so that I can’t tell if it’s empty by lifting it because the kettle alone weighs so much. It is also not particularly fast to boil. Overall, if I were to do it again, I would go for a stainless steel or glass kettle.

We have had ours for almost 3 years and it looks like new! it is elegant, very easy to clean, there are no plastic parts in contact with the water. It takes a little longer to boil water than other brands for it keeps it hot for longer. We love that the on off has a cool bright light that is very easy to see from our living room.

Replace your lid answer! Ours broke and I found this from the manufacturer website: ♂

The BELLA Team
· 15 days ago
Good morning Johannes. Yes, we sure do! For any spare part inquiries please reach out to our customer service team at 1-866-832-4843 and one of our agents will be happy to help you out with your request. Thanks and have a great day!

I purchased this kettle from Target before I realized amazon had it. I've had it for a year now and have used it probably 30 to 40 times. I really love it. I originally bought it for a tea party where I knew I would need a lot of hot water for individual herbal teas but didn't have time to watch the kettle/ keep the water hot. This heats up so quickly that I could go to get more hot water, flip it on, and have it boiling again in a minute or two.

This tes kettle is definitely adorable. It did take me some time to get used of the weight of the kettle. I did come up with a way of pouring while supporting the base with my opposite hand. Regretfully the on/off switch broke on my unit just this past week. I have only had it since Mother’s Day. There was a video review by another customer who had the same experience.

After taking a trip to Iceland and having an electric kettle in our room we decided that we had to have one for our house. We were gifted the 1.8 liter Chevron kettle and have used it multiple times a day for at least 3 months now. It is phenomenal! No issues cleaning it, it heats up in just a few minutes and sits perfectly next to my tea chest.

Beautiful electric kettle. I use it daily for tea, coffe or to warm water for my babies bottle. I did try to wipe dry and cut myself with the metal stick so beware. I usually turn it upside down with no lid for it to dry for a bit in order to prevent odor.

reviews.reviewTitle: Love love love it going on years now, still good.
reviews.reviewText: I use this kettle every single day multiple times and it has never failed me. The word "MAX" rubbed off I dont remember how long ago, but the outside is still pristine, the lid still works and the gasket has not gotten old or damaged at all. It is heavy, but hey it is solid ceramic, what do you expect.

It is a beautiful pot, the water does not touch any plastic, and it boils water quickly; the only drawback I could detect is that is it quite heavy, so if you have weakness in your hands or wrists, arthritis, etc., I would not recommend this pot.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great Gift Idea and for Yourself
reviews.reviewText: This was a gift for my Daughter and she LOVES IT! She says she uses it daily and is just so happy I got it for her. So am I, yes I would recommend this to anyone, as a Gift or for themselves!

reviews.reviewTitle: I have a big beautiful kitchen and don't like ugly appliances on my counters
reviews.reviewText: I bought a Bella from another major retailer because I found the pattern I wanted &fit was less expensive. After nearly burning down my kitchen twice with melted kettles on my stove (from forgetting to switch off the burner) I decided an electric kettle was in order. I have a big beautiful kitchen and don't like ugly appliances on my counters. The Bella is absolutely stunning! It's super heavy due it being ceramic, so if you have bad wrists buyer be ware.

reviews.reviewTitle: This is massive and very heavy. It takes up ...
reviews.reviewText: This is massive and very heavy. It takes up an enormous amount of space for a teapot. It's not safe to use something this heavy to pour HOT WATER. I returned it because it was not functional and I was charged $10 for return shipping--- arg!!! No doubt it is expensive to ship given that it's ABSURDLY HUGE AND CRAZY HEAVY.

I’ve had this tea kettle for three years now and have used it at least once a day everyday for that time. It still works just as well as the first day I bought it! The tea kettle is sturdy, boils quickly, and is incredibly easy to clean. Three years in and still not a single issue. I still regard this electric kettle as my best purchase of all time. I highly reccomend it!

reviews.reviewTitle: I would not recommend (unless you like to play Russian roulette
reviews.reviewText:
I bought it in Walmart on May 15 and it died on Oct 15 (just after 5 months!)
Very low reliability!

I had few electric kettles before in a couple of years and they all still working (!). This was the first one which died so fast!
I would not recommend (unless you like to play Russian roulette :)

reviews.reviewTitle: The unit won't turn on, heres why
reviews.reviewText:
After a year of use, this thing had been great. Except every so often I have to take the plastic Bottom of and re attach the heating recepticle. One of the plastics prongs broke off and if one of my kids try to use it they drop it on the pedestal and end up knocking the whole black piece in the picture into the base. Which prevents the unit from turning on.

I just remove the three Philips head screws and lock back into place. The fourth screw I threw away because ir was a triangle and annoying to take a triangle screw out.

reviews.reviewTitle: I love love love my kettle
reviews.reviewText: I love love love my kettle... since I am not a coffee drinker, I thought getting a kettle would be a good idea but I didn't want one that went on the stove... this kettle is pleasant to the eye on the counter top and is definitely a conversation piece for my company... the water also heats really fast. It's the perfect gift for tea and cocoa lovers!
I love this kettle! Is fast and I love the fact that there is no plastic in contact with my water. I’ll be getting another one as a gift this Christmas!
Great kettle, very quiet! Only thing is that because its ceramic, it is a bit heaver than most kittles, so lifting a full kittle may be an issue for folks that have a weak grip.

Bought at a big box store. After about 9-10 months of use, at least once per day, I noticed leakage. The pot had cracked...minuscule cracks that weren’t visible except for the steady dip-drop of water along the sides. At first I couldn’t figure out where it was coming from. Very pretty, but not well made. Sad.

reviews.reviewTitle: I bought this for my dad since he's constantly drinking ...
reviews.reviewText: I bought this for my dad since he's constantly drinking tea day in and day out. It heats the entire kettle in just a few minutes and keeps it warm for hours. It's incredibly handy if you drink tea regularly.
I love the look that this gives to my kitchen. it also works really well, but i wish that it held more water since i use this to make batches of iced tea.
This is adorable out on the counter top. The kettle works great and heats the water quickly. I do, however, wish it wasn't so heavy.

::::: GOOD KETTLE NO PLASTIC:::::
- Heats quickly and quietly
- Stainless bottom with rubber gasket
- The wife loves the looks
-NO INTERIOR PLASTIC
After TWO RAPID FAILURES of chef's choice kettles we decided to try another brand.

This is an great investment for tea junkies or people who enjoy a fresh pour-over brewed cup of café. I literally use this multiple times a day and it heats the water quickly and quietly. Not to mention, it's a beautiful addition to any decor.

reviews.reviewTitle: Worked until the return policy expired.
reviews.reviewText: It lasted a little over a month, now the boiler stays on regardless of if the switch is on or off. Thankfully we noticed this so it didn’t cause a fire.

The kettle cracked after 8 months of use. It was great, while it lasted. Then one morning I turned it on and it cracked open, spilling hot water so over the counter. The "Min" line it's clearly marked and the kettle was filled above that line when it cracked.
This ceramic kettle is very good! It is different with other normal metal Kettle. It looked very! It is also very fast to boil water.
Love this thing so far! It isn’t the fastest electric teapot, however the design is killer!
Fast boil, looks great on my countertop

reviews.reviewTitle: I use it at least twice a day and couldn't love it more
reviews.reviewText: I've had this kettle for over a year and I'm crazy about it. I use it at least twice a day and couldn't love it more. It is heavy but so well-made and that's what I look for. I definitely recommend it.
I hardly used it and it already quit working. I’m very disappointed
Very heavy, otherwise love this kettle. Attractive and functional. The heavy ceramic stays warm a long time. I've had mine at least three years and it still works great!
So beautiful and functional! I get compliments on it all the time!

reviews.reviewTitle: I love my ceramic tea kettle
reviews.reviewText: I love my ceramic tea kettle, I was concerned about the odor that folks had mentioned and I did not have any odor at all. It is beautiful and heats water so quickly. Great purchase for myself.
Very pretty but cracked during boiling at less than 3 months old.
My sister got me this for Christmas and I love it! Heats up super quick ad automatically turns off when finished!!
Bought this as a house warming gift. They loved the kettle.
love it , very good quality , good looking too, could not complain, cant find any cons
3 months later the cheap tin interior base is rusting ruining flavor and usefulness. This should be stainless steel. Very lame.

reviews.reviewTitle: I drink coffee and tea, all day everyday

reviews.reviewText: Beautiful kettle. I like that there's no plastic, like so many others. More expensive, but definitely worth it.

I bought this at Target approximately two years ago and was very happy with it, functionally and visually, until now. It just stopped working. Now it's repurposed as a watering can for the plants on my porch (though it is kind of heavy).

reviews.reviewTitle: It's beautiful and quick rolling boil
reviews.reviewText: It's beautiful and quick rolling boil. But very heavy with water in it. The handle stays cool but the spout and base get hot so you cannot lift with two bare hands to pour.

reviews.reviewTitle: Beware of plastic parts inside kettle
reviews.reviewText: This is not solid ceramic inside. Has a metal plate on the bottom, a metal tube spanning the height of the kettle with plastic parts inside. Was hoping it was somewhat free of other materials.
Works amazing
We purchased one of these and love it! It heats up quickly, easy to handle and looks beautiful.
I absolutely love this product!

I bought this at Target, it's beautiful but had to return it because it's too heavy - before you even fill it with water. No 'screen' either. But for looks it's a 5 star! I'm here on Amazon to get another since I returned this one.

reviews.reviewTitle: Dont buy it. Try a diferent style
reviews.reviewText: Don't buy it, The top is easy to brake the water taste different then the regular kettles. Try a different brand of style. I was thinking about getting an induction stove top and use that instead of this. its more expensive but you get to use the heating element on other cookware.
